reviewText:
Early Access Review

Full review can be found below. I will be providing a quick pro's and con's summary at the top for those that can't be bothered to read words.


Pro's:

+ CryEngine. Powerful engine that is not used often.
+ Graphics are better than most similar survival games.
+ Unlimited potential. They want to do a lot with it, and they very well might.
+ Cheap. $25 for an indie game is about right. Might seem a little high when compared to the $15 ones.

Con's:

- Brand new, unknown developer. No official studio, no known prior projects.
- Lack of content (this is to be expected in its current stage).
- Clunky animations of players, and AI.
- Broken AI (absolutely not worth even playing for PvE content right now)
- Boring. It boils down to going in and testing it out, while killing other players. That's all there is to do.
- Map size is small, and player count too high (as the map expands, I imagine this will be less of an issue). I ran into people left and right when there were 12+ on the server. Ran into 2 people when it had 9 total on the server.


Full Review:

Development team - Unknown to the world. Appears that most of the people involved in the project are all overseas and they are coordinating via their website and Skype. No official studio location. The LLC (company) registers out of Utah and the address shows a million dollar home that's up for sale. No other projects that they have worked on that is worth mentioning... so what they are capable of, has yet to be seen.


Premise of the game - It's a post apocalyptic world that has been done many times over. Lots of the same old farmland, mountains, and buildings spread out around the map. Only one major town on the map right now, and depending on your spawn point could be an absolute pain to get to. Story goes something along the lines of a (nuclear?) fallout war that destroyed the worlds nations and caused mutants in the process (these are the AI).


Engine - Probably the biggest draw for me is the presence of the CryEngine. A pretty powerful engine, it fuels the game and does an ok job at it. Small things like water beading off of your face (screen) when swimming, and lighting is definitely gained from here. There are some issues that I'll explain more about later that I would imagine they'll need to smooth out with the engine.


Graphics - Surprisingly, the game is stable with the graphics cranked to the max. I get about 50fps and not a single crash yet. The graphics look good, but certainly not amazing. We're not talking Crysis CryEngine level graphics here. They're definitely not going to require the absolute top of the line PC. I run a AMD 1075T (3.0ghz) CPU, an R9 270X 4G graphics card, and 16GB of g.skill RAM (1600mhz). I don't have any issues at all but then my set up is probably better than most casual players. I will say I was a little impressed with some of the lighting (like the flashlights at night) and effects. I had to immediately turn off the garbage head bob and blur.


Performance - As stated above I get an average of about 50fps constant. I've not had any crashes though I did get a black screen after activating the showfps command. I ended up having to kill the process to get back in-game. Players are pretty smooth, though it's clear that some people do warp around a little (this could be a communication issue with everyone involved, or just that player having a bad connection). Most people I ran into, didn't do this for me.


Anti-cheat -  Non-existent as far as I'm aware. I went onto the dev forums and asked about the anti-hack plans... I was told and I quote... We have a bunch of ninjas spying you". I've asked for some clarification
date: but I'm wondering if they're going to try the whole approach that Nether did of
recommended:
"We'll monitor players with staff". Which clearly failed.


Content - As an early Alpha
hoursPlayed: it lacks all content. You have food and drink items
voteText: you have some melee weapons
helpfulPercent: a single pistol
votesHelpful: but that's about it. Some clothing items makes your character model (same male figure for everyone) look a little different than the next guy
votesTotal: but not by much. At one point I found a pistol
votesFunny: and the largest backpack in the game... and that was end game for me. This is all expected to improve over time
commentsCount: so understand where it sits now in the development stage. Of note for future content is a building system shown in a video
column16: vehicles
column17:
and more.


AI - The game features mutants as opposed to zombies. Right now they're utterly broken. So stand in place and do nothing

I think this is the third time I've reviewed this game.  First time positive, second time a frustrated negative, but in fairness the potential has always been there, and progress has never stopped even if in some cases it was too slow, but they are a growing Indie, and not a bad one.  Just not always great with PR (frankly not too many developers are) but they are responsive.  The game now has reached a plateau from which I think the player base (already decently active) will really begin to grow, and I predict that the old, early mixed review" state will soon be overcome.

Here is a brief review and outlook

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, I thought it was gonna be yet another crappy early access survivor game....it basically is, lets be honest. But to be fair it's basically a better H1Z1, a much better infestation or whatever the hell those greedy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s are calling their game this week. Not as good as DayZ after thier 6.0 patch in my opinion but this game isn't bad at all and worth the $20 bucks if you got it to throw down for one of these games.

Generally I think this game suffers from a pretty unintuative user interface (I had a gun, pressed R to reload ammo from my inventory into it...had to do it through the G menu). The loot tables are pretty slim pickings, But I think this is pretty common for these kinds of games, one week its guns and ammo everywhere and next week theres no food anywhere cause devs are always messing with it, which is fine. I think alot of the animations are pretty janky, which is fine. performance is actually...pretty damn good, had 60+ FPS with no hitching or drops (had two small 2 second hiccups while it was raining super hard, which is pretty dismissable)

Overall, this thing has potential to be decent and in the very least a nice break from DayZ while they are getting their ♥♥♥♥ together for some of the patches where the game is literally unplayable, decent work devs. Keep it up, but it's a long road ahead for you boys.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I started almost a year ago. Miscreated was pretty bad back then when i remember it so i left it. Fast forward roughly 7 months and i hop back on Miscreated and i'm quite happy with what i get. Base building, new animations, slightly bigger community, etc. Game is looking great and for a small dev team, updates aren't decades away or hour updates with rushed work.

Once i came back to miscreated i noticed something good.  The first 5 players i ran into were young adults which is a good sign. The community isn't ALWAYS kill on sight but a game can't avoid kill on sight. You can't punish a survival game when the point of the game is survival even if that is killing on sight. Back on track, i met up with this guy. We talked for a bit and he brought me ack to his base. He gave me some basic stuff and we set out. This night was the night i started my miscreated clan that lasted well over 3 months. We met up with 3 other people and tagged along, Then with another 2 people and lastly with 1 lone wolf. We had a gang. We had so many members we had to make a distinct look for eachother so we wouldn't injure or kill eachother in combat. So we all went muscle shirt. We were the Muscle Shirt Gang. We chilled for a good 6 hours that day and played very late into the night.

After we establised ourselves the fun began. My bud brought us all to his base and we sat in a circle and told jokes, laughed and had a good ol'time. It was a blast. This lasted a while and we started branching out making our on bases. slowly we started raiding other bases and we successfully raided over 10 bases in our time. Raiding is tough in miscreated so raids take some time due to the manwork you have to put in to take down 1 wall.

The group lasted for 3 months until we disbanded, slowly we just left eachother, no good byes, no good lucks, just leaving 1 by 1. Out of all people i still have 1 good guy i play games with. This guy i play with doesn't just play Miscreated with me anymore, but tons of other games too. He is undoubtly my best online bud to hop on and play some survival games with.

Overall, my experience was amazing. I met a lot of cool, mature people and had a blast. I can't say your experience will be the same or as good as mine, but i can say the games is a blast and is a bargain. Who knows you might have a better experience than me! They even lowered the price a few dollars so it's a good game.

Im sad my review and adventures have come to an end but yours can start so pick up this game and go enjoy it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a truly amazing game, I don't even know where to start.

PROS:

-Dev team updates often
-Gorgeous CryEngine graphics & textures
-Vehicles that are a ton of fun to fix up and drive
-Great combat, lots of different weapons
-Fun community
-Cool setting, feels like a zombie game but actually is about post-nuclear war survival with mutants (basically zombies)
-Pretty big map, big expansion coming very soon for a huge city
-Extremely detailed (way diff than dayz detail, way more thought put into each building)
-Awesome FPS, unlike dayz you can easily get a butter smooth framerate with a half decent comp. Even runs well on low end pcs at low settings.
-Base building that is fun as hell.  You can basically build anywhere you want, hold down a road if u like. Creates interesting gameplay
-Dynamic weather is interesting and scary (storms actually make the game feel eerie)

CONS:

-Private servers are only available through one provider.  Kinda slimy and I assume a way for the devs to cut extra profit, the provider is also overpriced.
-Server files aren't public, so making a modded server with oxide or any API will not be possible :(
-Dying happens really fast. If you get shot in the head or chest and its a kill shot, you will instantly go to a death screen and not be able to see how you died or who killed you.  You almost never even hear the gun fire that killed you because it instantly turns to death screen.
-No storage system for bases yet, but apparently coming in the next patch so don't let that discourage you.

Overall this game is a lot of fun.  The devs update a lot and the gameplay is awesome.  I wish they would make server files public and will continue to fight for that to happen. Join this community and help it grow, it deserves more praise than DayZ which is a barely functional ♥♥♥♥♥how of a game that will never work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Saw this game at PAX East, and got to talk to one of the folks in the booth for a bit. I felt bad that I didn't take the opportunity to play, as while we were chatting about the horror/survival genre in general (a la The Forest, Amnesia, DayZ, etc.) a few spots opened up. I declined to play, but did want to check back in to say that this game is absolutely beautiful and the gameplay is addictive: slinking around an apocalyptic mountain region, looting anything you can find in an effort to either not get mauled by a roaming zombie, or killed by another player. What's not to like?

The day/night cycles are amazing, and I just witnessed my first lightning storm which was incredible; CryEngine FTW. And while friendly confrontations with players are possible, most end in bloodshed, but some are akin to two ships passing in the night, if you're lucky - and not armed enough to want to attack the other person :-)

Crafting is interesting; it seems like it would take a _lot_ of effort to build a structure. I was lucky enough to find a hatchet during a random spawn once, and given the inventory size, it just wasn't feasible. Even with several more slots; I'm also not sure I'd want to put effort into a structure that I probably won't be able to find later, but maybe there's an ability to set a respawn point; not sure, but that'd be ideal. I have many an hour on ARK, and while dying in hardcore survival is expected, I do feel as though I really shouldn't get attached to any items whatsoever in Miscreated since I've yet to recover a body. I don't mind this though - I've read a lot of quibbling about loot being too sparse, and that happens to be a major plus for me; loot is extremely valuable in this game; that's awesome; it's a bold choice that not a lot of games take, and I think that really set it apart from the rest.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSurvivors log - Day one: I begin writing this in hopes someone...ANYONE will find it, for it seems...I am alone. After hearing some strange sounds I begin looking for people...It seems I can hear them all around me. As I spin around in a circle it seems I hear more, no wait. Is that my own footsteps? What is this clanking sound that makes me think I'm being shot at? Paranoia sets in as I trudge on down a dirt road. I soon spot a house that is of course abandoned I look everywhere for something to smack around these things that have been following me should they get ballsy enough. Nothing but a 'plebsi' and some ravioli...I look out the window to see a blurry house in the distance...yes, I must go there I tell myself. I keep hearing these sounds so I yell out Hey
date: IS ANYONE THERE''? No response of course..I run out the door
recommended: jump the 4-5 foot tall fence without a scratch and press on...More sounds
hoursPlayed: this time it sounds like someone is swinging. I turn around frantically looking for the source. NOTHING. My sight blurrs...then darkness all around me. I guess I closed my eyes because in an instant everything was back to normal. Just a fluke I guess..I make my way to the next house cautiously and find a hatchet! Oh
voteText: ho ho! The smile that came over my face...I grab the axe in my right hand and swing wildly cutting everything in the house...which oddly enough has the same sound for everything I hit. I begin to yell and taunt those following me with my outside voice...No response...It seems I'm getting tired...will continue log in the morning.\n\nSurvivors log - Day 2: I begin my morning only to find for some reason everything I had found besides my axe were missing
helpfulPercent: 'no matter' I tell myself...'but that kinda sucks' I press on determined to find the lost 'plebsi' as I was a bit thirsty.  Wait wait

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is exactly how a post-apocalyptic MMO should have been and developed. I have played DayZ and Miscreated; personally, Miscreated scores the win on this one. The game runs smooth on ultra with the gameplay and combat much more satisfying than DayZ. And like the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t DayZ throws on us, this game is actually developing with regards to what the early access players want. Currently there are enough number of weapons to satisfy the marksman in you, but more are being added with each upcoming patch! Moreover, if you're into co-op, there are a few friendly servers that maintain a healthy relationship between every player. Now it's impossible to find a less-eccentric player that does not want blow a hole through your head in DayZ. So Miscreated is worth the buy and I recommend one buys it now because with it's potential, it might increase the price once the early access is done, which I'm pretty sure will happen soon.
In short, Miscreated is the best of it's kind on Steam right now. I wonder how it has 'mixed' reviews...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Good:  This is simply the best looking game of this genre.  The environs are beautifully crafted.  The interiors feel real, the exteriors are very convincing.  The rats and snakes scattering about are a great touch (although I couldn't kill and eat them).  Almost everything felt right.  I'm not saying there isn't room for improvement but the dev team clearly knows where that is and given what they've done so far, this game will be a sight to behold when it's complete.

Observations:  As far as game-play, there is clearly work to be done. But there are some great steps they've already made that are evident in the current build.  I like the limited inventory and the ability to store stuff in my shirt pocket.  There is work to be done on what has been implemented and obviously, there are many needed features (such as storage and fleshing out crafting).  A few things that disappointed me.  First, I want to be able to interact with everything, 7DTD has done an amazing job with this but their world in nowhere near as visually rich.  I get there's a trade-off happening here but a happy middle ground would be appreciated. 7DTD has to execute on a few things yet but it is poised to be one of the best games I've ever played.  Completely augmentable environments is the reason why, and this alone will make me overlook any number of it's shortcomings.

Clearly, after reading some of the devs posts, they are on the right path and have a unique and interesting take on a very overdone theme.  But they have a lot of work to do in order to compete with 7DTD.

The Bad:  I played for about 2 hours and then it crashed (as of 10/10/2015).  I can't open the game anymore.  after looking at how active the devs are, I have confidence they will fix it.

Final:  If you have limited funds, wait for this one to develop more.  But, If you, like me, enjoy supporting game development go for it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

11:26 PM updated!
Happiest day in Apirl, application essay is finished, and I turned off the Motion Blur and I no longer feel dizzy!

TL;DR
Makes me dizzy, but everything is great so far, absolutely worth buying at -50% discount

I never feel dizzy in any other video game, but after playing half of an hour I really wanted to lay in my bed... I don't blame this game though.
I play on a 14'' laptop and I haven't played FPS with Keyboard+mouse for six months, I only play RTS with K+M and for other games with my XO controller, however I play most of the FPS on ps4 with a bigger monitor.
I think one of reasons is I have to turn around and look closely at objects in order to find loots, so play it on a bigger screen guys for your eyes and your health and your playing pleasure.

After exitting the game I couldn't do anything else for the entire day so I had to keep watching Youtube videos and I couldn't start writing my application essay until 8PM

But this game looks absolutely stunning, good texture, good fx, animation in game is way much better than what they showed in the video up there, everything is good and it runs so smooth. Atomsphere done right, I did expect zombie when I enter buildings, and I encountered the first zombie in a building, really immersive. And the loots show up in where they are supposed to show up, JOB VERY WELL DONE!  DayZ 0.60 is still on the way so this game is currently somehow better than DayZ, excet DayZ doesn't make me dizzy (I played DayZ and ArmA2 and ArmA3 for over one thousand hours so I'm pretty used to their engine)

Community is fine, met pretty much five people today only one guy tried to kill me with a baseball bat

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing only 10 hours on the game, I can say only a few things..

Firstly, this game is beautiful, It's the best looking post-apocolypse survival genre game out there to date. It is a very under rated game and deserves a lot more attention. The lack of players right now is not a bad thing, infact for me it was great, it allowed me to get a grip of how the game worked and how the engine feels. For me it was amazing, even with every setting maxed out, I had a smooth 45-60 FPS deep in very detailed parts of the map and I dont have the best of PCs.

Secondly, the engine for this game right now feels and plays wonderfully. I have not come across any major bugs, especially for such a unpopular game, that's amazing. Loot seems to work just fine, and as far as I can tell the base building it good, and the raiding system works moderatly well for such an early access game.

If this game had sufficient advertising I believe it would easily of been a better hit than other popular survival games which turned out pretty crappy, *cough* you know which ones im talking about.

Finally, this game reaches out and takes aspects of other survival games out there, bundling it into one great, beautiful and smooth game THAT ACTUALLY WORKS *GASP*. It truly does deserve more attention and more advertising.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well let me start with, DONT BE FOOLED WITH THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS.

Most of the negative reviews are people who got the game and started hating on it before they even launched it as it Early access and asked for a refund before they clicked play!! Also this game has been heavly modifed and improved the last 2 months which sets a side the negative views from the past as honestly wasnt that good.

YES IT ♥♥♥♥ING IS EARLY ACCESS but let me tell you something its a ♥♥♥♥ing good early access game. I had a game for 3 days and yes there are a few bug here and there but non of them stop you from playing the game.

For example: Flickering lght, Yes it has been noticed by the devs and its being worked on but there is a simple fix. Restart the game.  BOOM DONE OMFG its magic. (it rarly ever happens)

Another example: Can click on a teb or cant find a server. BOOM restart DONE!!! (happned once out of 35 times i launched it.

This game has so much potential and dont get me started on the graphics and it by far has the best looking graphics then any other survival game out there. (this game makes dayz look like a 2d game)

So back to the game play.

I personnaly like the hardcore gameplay and finding people in game now is not a problem. Recently its been getting attention as it should. It takes a while to loot up as that is relistic and not everyone has guns which means alot of melee action and if they do have a gun the gun probably dont have more then 8 shots . as ammon is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing rare.

If I were to rate the game on the gameplay it would be 10/10
Fluent and stable game                                                     8/10  There are minor bugs but non affect gameplay as a simple restart would do.

Should you get it. HELL YES if you are willing to start the game with a smile.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm going to talk about the good to this game first, then the negative before I offer my suggestions.

Firstly, this game is fun in many ways. It is a gritty, semi-realistic survival simulator. Using crazy people instead of zombies is very interesting and breaks away from the norm, so kudos on that.

I also like the fact loot isn't just sprawled every two feet across the game world and that you have to actually LOOK for it. It isn't always in the open people. The mutants" are strong and freaky
date: which is good because it adds to the challenge. It makes you have to actually use your brain and think
recommended: strategize about what you do instead of just charging in and killing everything that moves.\n\nNow where it needs improvement. Although I DO like the realism of having to search for loot instead of it laying in the open
hoursPlayed: it is a bit TOO difficult to find anything useful half the time. Not to mention you usually end up running into the enemies before you even find a t-shirt
voteText: which brings me to my next point.\n\nHaving difficult enemies can be a good thing
helpfulPercent: but the problem with this game is it isn't balanced. Risk versus reward is key in these games
votesHelpful: and with the enemies being so much faster and stronger than the player
votesTotal: it makes things very frustrating.\n\nThe other area that needs improvement is re-spawning. There needs to be something coded into the game that prevents you from being spawned too close to mutants. Close is fine at times
votesFunny: but there has to be a line. At one point
commentsCount: I actually respawned across the map directly in a group of 6 or 7 mutants! I'm talking surrounded and inches away. I didn't even try to run.\n\nOverall
column16:
I would say it is very well executed for an early access pre-alpha game. It is fun and entertaining but can be VERY frustrating. My recommendation would be to go for it and try it. It might seem like the price tag is high versus the issues but consider other games in the genre. It may or may not get MORE expensive down the road once it is done.

My suggestions are as follows:
1. Tone down the mutants strength and/or size a little bit
column17: it far outweighs the reward.\n2. Rather than toning them all down
column18: maybe consider scaling each one differently for variety
column19: some weaker than others and some stronger.\n3. If the enemies are not scaled
column20: at the very least make offensive/defensive loot a bitmore prevalent. Kinda sucks to get trapped in a huge building that has nothing but clothing and ammo for guns you can never find\n4. Improve the respawn coding. Again
column21: it sucks big time to be spawned inches from the mutant threat.\n\nKeep an open mind when playing this game
column22: and if you leave a review
column23: be it good or negative
column24: try to be constructive instead of flaming the boards. The game gets better by constructive criticism not rudeness."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a beautiful looking game, but lacks features and things to do! Once you've explored the map, you only have the players to rely on for entertainment... that usually ends with a lot of KOS (Kill on sight).
Graphically this game is amazing, but I cant give it a thumbs up until theres more to do :(

EDIT: 18/10/2015

My recommendation fro this game has changed from no to yes!

I recently started playing this game again as vehicles and best of all, base building have been added! The only thing we are waiting for now is item storage, this will make the game a lot more enjoyable and will offer players a much better experience overall.
All of that as well as a planned map expansion will really make Miscreated a game worth playing!

Cons: Hardly any (if any) AI enemies like mutants to fight/run from, occasional light glitches and problems with in game voice. The game is still in alpha though so these things are to be expected :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TLDR: I totally reccomend this game, it's certainly a gem in the middle of a saturated market of survival games that have become a trend in the recent years, and it seems like the perfect game to stick to, to be a part of, and help grow.

First off, let's get a couple of things straight:
- This is an Early Access Alpha. If you are not sure what that means, do some research.
- The negative reviews were due to a rocky launch back in 2014, as you'll see, you'll need to scroll quite a bit until you reach a true, honest negative review(Yeah, because most people seem to forget what Alpha means, and what your job, as a TESTER, is).
That said, I'm wondering where to start for Miscreated..
It is a breeze of fresh air in the genre I would say. I've had more fun with Miscreated than I did in DayZ or other survival games akin to it.


Positive+It is genuinely fun. Playing with friends, or even just meeting a random stranger can be tense and end up in a very fun experience. Or not. But it'll still be funny!
+Great Dev communication, Devs actually CARE, and you can SEEand EXPERIENCE how much work they've put into this game.
+Rare KoS(Kill on Sight)
+Great optimization
+Great graphics
+Great Gameplay

Negative- Loading into a server takes a while, although it has been confirmed it varies depending on hardware(usually 3 minutes for me)..


Now thing is, I can only really point out that one flaw, simply because there's really not much more that's bad" about it.
Who in their right mind would add "bugs" as a negative point to an early access alpha? Of course it has bugs
recommended: spazzing vehicles that kill you if you get close
hoursPlayed: but they're constantly being worked on. I've only played for about 10 hours
voteText: but I've been following development before I purchased the game
helpfulPercent:
because Dev activity with the community is something I value a lot.


The game has a good amount of content so far
votesHelpful: and what's done so far is good. Do I have suggestions? Sure
votesTotal: but as soon as you start playing you'll also understand the Dev's vision for this game. New features and content are implemented
votesFunny: and the Devs are very open about it

Early Access Review

First impressions are good, they have put in some good features like you have to find different parts for vehicles and so. The graphics is good, and to be an alpha game it is really easy to run, you dont need a kickass computer to run this game at max settings.
When it comes to building I would say they have to do some more work, like when placing a wall onto an platform, its an gap between the platform and the wall, you can lower or raise platforms, that means you have to find an area that is completly flat, kind of dissapointing for a game that looks as good and dont have to many bugs.
Only bugs discoverd so far is the vehicle sounds, they do sometimes not sound at all if your friend is driving the vehicle. They should consider that when you cut trees to get wood piles the tree should fall down after some wood piles.
After some more playing, the weapons reaload should have been done someting with, should have made it possible to reload with a button and not have to get into inventory and then change mag on the inventory slots.
For the blueprints, wood and so for base should have not been on blueprints if you ask me, have benn looting for 10 hours, back and forwards into diffrent towns and buildings around, have just found silly things that i absolutly dont need to craft.
Storage box or safe or something like that should have been ingame. For the vehicles , od that you can store just as much in a car or quad bike as in a truck ? does not make any sence for me.

As the game looks now, it might be an really good game when it is done

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can't tell you how much I'm enjoying this early access game. I don't think ANY other survival type game has nailed the atmoshphere of this game. The map is such plain drop dead gorgeous!!!!! When you go into a town it feels so realistic. Everything is overgrown and looks like a real apocolypse has happened. I love that there are so many places to hide and sneak around. The first time a deer darts out of a bush, it scares the crap out of you. The feeling of being one of the last few survivors is incredible. The lighting and the leaves gently falling around you. The rats scurrying from garbage almost makes you smell the stench. Loot is hidden among things and you have to actually search to find some of it. There is no watching a circle spin and count down here. If you don't search you may not find.

Everything is so detailed. The houses, the interiors of different things. There are even tunnels to explore.

Your map has been so thoughtfully designed. If you are a lone wolf explorer it is just a joy to look around and see what you can find. If you are looking for pvp, I can't think of a better designed map. You can hide and ambush from so many different places. You can sneak around on hidden goat paths. You can hide in craggy rocks and defend yourself if pinned down. The trees and bushes and even the undergrowth provides great concealment. Dayz could only dream of having this kind of environment and have it run this smooth. I have a 680Ti and a 2600k and I run this thing maxed out and it's smooth as butter.

The vehicles are fun to drive and easy to control. This game has so much potential it is staggering. Is it perfect? Obviously not. The mutants need work, and more variety. More weapons, scopes, binoculars, different clothing and different character models are going to eventually be needed. I have no doubt that all of those things will come as the game engine is tweaked and they get the connection problems sorted out for some people.

If you need a game that has lots of players involved in it right away, you may want to wait. If you enjoy exploring and watching a game evolve, this is the best I have seen to date and I hope the devs get tons of support once they start to market it more. Great job devs! I await the next update.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, absolutely love the game. Not a big survival fan, am now. Spent hours on end exploring, going into every house, walking through the woods and finding cabins, wildlife, rivers, creeks, deer trails, random dirt roads, its endless. But its not boring, the whole time you're doing it is literally a blast, very immersive.  The Cry engine looks amazing, awesome draw distance, wonderful textures, overall very polished and the game is still in alpha. I can only expect more amazing updates from the boys at Entrada. You make friends and enemies, find some trolls every now and then, find abandon bases, fallen players with possibly that little bit of food you need in their possession, Game play mechanics are wonderful, have already gotten two of my good friends into this game and they absolutely love it. I  really haven't been doing much gaming lately but I've been spending a lot of time with my computer thanks to this purchase. I think the crafting system is great, and have been staying updated with the dev blogs and what they have in store will be only improvements. I really recommend this game for really anyone since I am not the type to play this kind of game, but i have thoroughly enjoyed it and have been hooked since i bought it.


One thing I would change, and don't bash me, I know the bicycles are the newest update, but you can be going as slow as you can and if you accidentally hit a friend it kills them immediately. I still haven't figured out body temperature yet, and have yet to see the radiation bar go up. None of this has even bothered me, it is more of just figuring out how everything works. I also wish you could have a game lobby, and maybe some sort of kill cam besides just going to a black screen leaving you wondering how you even died.

i give it a 10/10, considering how it stacks up against other survival games, like dayz being in alpha for ages. I'm genuinely excited to see what in store for this game, i have not touched any one of the other 15 games on my computer since i have got it, I'm excited to get home and play it everyday, explore more of the map, see what other items I can craft or find, or find new buddies to play with. Keep it up Entrada, amazing game, seriously, I love it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Miscreated is a multiplayer open world survival game in which you fight against the elements, environment and living beings after a devastating war, you will start in the world with a T-Shirt, Jeans and a Flash light in which your goal will be to gear up by scavenging nearby houses, car parks, schools and other potential looting grounds for cars, weaponry, crafting components and tools. Combined with trying to avoid or possibly kill the existing mutants or survivors.

Something to note considering every other survival game has this issue is, the community isn't entirely a  Kill on Sight " type of mentality which is good
date: you'll get people chatting with you
recommended: trading or even possibly grouping up to defend against bandits or you may even decide to build your own base and hoard all the loot in the universe.\n\nThe developers also seem very passionate about their game and are listening to feedback and followed by that is great ideas for future updates which will definitely make this game even better

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you asked me a few months ago to write a review for this game it would not have been positive. It seemed just like a prettier version of a Dayz knockoff. Recently I took a second look and documented some of my play time and I am glad I did. The game is beautiful, without a doubt one of the prettiest enviroments I have experienced in any game, let alone a survival sim. It has lush forests beautiful water and all the homes look lived in. The developers paid close attention to make oridnary homes tell a story to the player. You may find a skull in a childs room, or boxes in a pile in a room as if the owners were attempting to gather their belongings and evacuate. These items a long with the scenery are some of the big pros to this game. Now, the game runs beautiful and the developers seemed to have paid attention to server optimization and making the game run smooth, as opposed to Dayz which in itself is pretty, but runs like a brick. The game features a crafting menu, as well as items to equip on your character. You can fight unarmed, but melee weapons and guns are available. Vehicles also appear in the game, as well as parts to repair them If there is a con, it is definatley the lack of player models and the limited amount of zombies. These things are trivial and will most likely be added in eventually and do not warrant a negative review in my opinion.
voteText: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun game, feels very polished. Graphics are great (Cryengine), combat feels smooth, survival is balanced - you will find food but if you're settling down to make a base you'll eventually need to go back to a city. Vehicles take effort (finding oil, fuel, drive belt, battery and spark plug) to get to work if you happen to find one so it's pretty satisfying/bit worrying driving about in one. Mutants are a decent threat if you're not equipped to deal with them, if you don't have a gun it's worth teaming and kiteing them to loot or just choosing a different, less infested zone.

Any issues are actively worked on by a small but dedicated group of developers who are present in the community and respond to any problems the players report.

Most of the negative reviews you'll see are from the initial release of the alpha when there were limited features and fewer players.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I walk along the highway, wondering where my next meal will come from. I haven't seen anyone for a long time... but I know they're there... Stinkin' bandits. Jumping out of nowhere, gunning you down for the measly salvage in your pockets. I look down the road and see a figure approaching. Without hesitation I bolt into the nearby foliage, hoping he didn't see me.

hello? Friendly dude."

He isn't approaching anymore. His hand waves to me in a peaceful manner.

"need any food man? I could use some rope. Got any rope?"

I don't trust him. yeah I've got rope... three coils of the stuff... how's my hunger bar? Below 50%... not good.

"yeah I've got rope. What kind of food you got?"

"A couple cans of tuna
date:
some peaches"

"I'll take the tuna"

"Awesome. Here you go"

The cans fall to the ground at his feet.
Do I take the bait? I see something at his side. is that his flashlight or a pistol? Definitely pistol. he could whip that out and cap me as I stand over the trade. Gotta risk it.

This is a typical encounter in Miscreated. It's a true survival format. Mutants

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I walk along the highway, wondering where my next meal will come from. I haven't seen anyone for a long time... but I know they're there... Stinkin' bandits. Jumping out of nowhere, gunning you down for the measly salvage in your pockets. I look down the road and see a figure approaching. Without hesitation I bolt into the nearby foliage, hoping he didn't see me.

hello? Friendly dude."

He isn't approaching anymore. His hand waves to me in a peaceful manner.

"need any food man? I could use some rope. Got any rope?"

I don't trust him. yeah I've got rope... three coils of the stuff... how's my hunger bar? Below 50%... not good.

"yeah I've got rope. What kind of food you got?"

"A couple cans of tuna
date:
some peaches"

"I'll take the tuna"

"Awesome. Here you go"

The cans fall to the ground at his feet.
Do I take the bait? I see something at his side. is that his flashlight or a pistol? Definitely pistol. he could whip that out and cap me as I stand over the trade. Gotta risk it.

This is a typical encounter in Miscreated. It's a true survival format. Mutants

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is well worth the money and should run on any platform. I run it on a laptop and I'm getting 60FPS anywhere on the map even in city areas (well done CryEngine)  Not only that, but the visual quality on this game is simply breathtaking, lot's of beautiful sceneries to explore and the developers have also added some pretty cool hidden locations to discover as well.

The only con to this game imo is the fact that everyone runs at the same pace, though the weight of your gear is suppose to slow you down, i really don't see a difference and makes it nearly impossible for a solo player to evade any large group of hostile players or even someone with an axe if you're out of ammo. If players had an exhaustion level then there would at least be more of a strategic behind sprinting.

Also, i've had many incidents where players i'm engaging in battle with would quickly exit game only to later return in order to replenish their blood loss and have the nerve to brag about it in game chat. That's a huge disappointment. Maybe try to add a certain amount of seconds before the players in-game character actually despawns, it'll add some anxiety to those players that try to cheat death.

Overall: 4.8
voteText: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMiscreated is a beautiful game. My play style in an open world game is typically as a wandering explorer. The map really sets the atmosphere of the game and there is a ton of detail. All the basic game mechanics work but there are some rough edges, especially with inventory management. I've had this game since it came out but honestly only started playing it to any extent after the latest patch, #35. In this update they added weather effects which are very well done. I look forward to having more survival mechanics such as hunting and cooking. Those are on the roadmap but progress has been slow. Overall I would reccomend this game if you are a fan of the genre and enjoy immersing yourself in a game environment. Bear in mind the early access status of the title.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Amazing!!
Seriously though if you are a fan of dayz, rust, or any multiplayer hardcore survival game this game is a must. Dayz has been rocky ever since it was made, and even close to their full release the game is still a buggy mess. Now Miscreated had an extremely buggy start, but in its current state (still prealpha mind you) it is insanely polished, beautiful, intense, and filled with potential. The game even now is loads of fun, and worth days upon days of hours plugged into it.
Dont be discouraged, give this game some love, these developers are making the next big survival game here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good game that is getting there, but still needs work. The basics are all there, but the controls can feel a little loose and clunky.

There is also an overwhelming lack of zombies (or whatever they are in this game) and weapons. Because of the lack of guns, the game lends itself to shoot-on-sight tactics to protect your loot which somewhat spoils the experience of encountering other players, because unless you are a fresh-spawn you're almost guaranteed to get killed immeadiately.

The best thing about this game is that unlike the others in this category *cough* DayZ *cough* this game is actually going somewhere in it's development.

This game is an investment, but one that I think will pay off in the end.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overall, the game appealed to me from the start: crafting, survival, zombie-like mutants, and interactions with other players. There are some great positives about the game. It's  very beautiful with realistic terrain and a peaceful, post apocalyptic atmosphere. I met some great people that brought me into their group. This being said, it doesn't make up for the overall lackluster nautre of the game. It just doesn't deliver, even for an early release and especially for the price.

-- World load times are very, very long. A little faith is needed to stick with the game when you log on as it seems that the client froze up. With a good computer and internet connection, it still takes a few minutes.

-- It's laggy when you move or turn your head, making it difficult to get immersed in the game. It's also a HUGE pain for trying to fight when turning quickly is probably the most important factor in killing or being killed.

-- There are few options for customizing the audio, video, or gameplay settings. Far far fewer than even the standard options offered in most games.

-- You spawn with nothing and spend A LOT of time to gather even basic food and weapons. Upon death, you lose everything. There is no way to store items except on your person. While starting from scratch and high death penalty can be seen as desirable things, not being able to rathole items, create defensive structures, or spawn relatively close to your body is very tedious. Getting to even a basic level of combat readiness can take anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes, depending on the luck of your spawn. Since PvE, PvP, and environmental hazards can lead to death relatively frequently, the fourth or seventh or twentieth time you have to start from scratch gets very old.

-- Items are a Catch 22. Players make the game interesting and items help you survive the playres. Item spawns are generally slow and certain useful ones are denser in a handful of areas (such as finding guns at the airbase). This means on maps with the highest chance of dieing (large numbers of players), there are fewer guns, ammo, melee weapons, and even basics such as food and water. It's almost neccesary to go to servers with few to no people on them in order to stock up after a death, but without other people, the danger is removed and the game is much less interesting. What's left is about 20-30 minutes of chore-like scavenging. The spawn rates should increase with the amount of people on the server, but it doesn't. This means you are continuously unprepared/spending inordinate amounts of time preparing on a high-traffic server, efficiently gathering on a low traffic server where there is a neglible chance of needing the items, or being forced to regularly switch back and forth, suffering through the long world load times twice after every death.

-- Despite a cool international community, the game doesn't support squad or multiplayer things for friends. The voice chat is difficult to hear and cuts out, almost requiring TeamSpeak instead of the ingame option. There are no ways to signal to them, or make a squad. It's difficult to tell people apart (my group took our shoes off to show we were allies -- if a stranger did the same, they'd blend in seamlessly). There is no revive or stabilize option (though this was mentioned as a future project) meaning that on death you respawn FAR away from your team. This takes a lot of time to run back to your team while they either sit and wait or run to you. Often, it is much quicker to suicide repeatedly until you spawn closer to them. A game which has suicide incentives like this is flawed.

-- The items are boring. The food, water, and soda show the most diversity and still lack creativity. (low quality graphics, lack of humor or character in branding, uninteresting containers) Cars are difficult to find and repair, but once made are simply a slightly faster way of getting around. Driving is clumsy and doesn't offer adrenaline pumping speed, maneuverability, or offensive capability. After being used, you basically have to leave the car when you log off, making the return on time invested a lot less worthwhile. Guns are not customizable and have one model per class for the most part. A single revolver, handgun, bolt action rifle, semi auto rifle, shotgun, etc. Reloading is also a pain, requiring one to open inventory and manually place ammo into the gun.

-- There are no safe zones, civilians, occupied towns, engaging or interesting NPCs, opportunities to trade, etc. Interactions with other players fall into three categories -- 1) they want to kill you 2) they want to join up to be protected from people that want to kill you 3) they don't want anything to do with you. Very shallow interactions.

-- Fall damage is ridiculous. Even a minor fall, say 10 feet, can lead to death. Rocks are especially difficult since they act almost slippery. It would make FAR more sense to have a realistic injury, such as sprained ankle impairing movement speed, or even breaking ones legs on a decent fall.

-- There isn't the ability to create a 'home' or defensive structure in this sandbox world. You can't build walls, barricade a house, dig into a hill, build a fort, establish a clan, set real traps, create defenses. Outside of this nomadic existence, there isn't a more defensive way to play. You either scavenge and kill with a team, or do so alone.

-- You can't interact with most of the world. Buildings don't change and are not destructible. Doors can't be opened or closed anymore. Trees can be cut for wood but do not get chopped down. Things such as flimsy wood baricades or small trees will stop a full speed car. Sleeping bags can't be looted. Books can't be read. Objects such as dumpsters or boxes can't be moved. Boxes or containers can't be broken to see what's inside.

-- Navigating is difficult and imo, unrealistic. Every road connecting cities and towns has signs poiting out directions, roads, advertisements, etc. In Miscreated, everything is pretty much along Route 88, all the gas stations look the same, and it's truly difficult to figure out where you are. The answer is to play long enough (and die often enough) that you memorize landmarks and spawn points. These are not iconic landmarks, mind you, but things like does the generic bridge have two
recommended: or four sections?" Each town looks very similar
hoursPlayed: lacking even the most rudimentary differences like business or street signs. The maps found on boards near some spawn points should be able to be 'committed to memory' in the game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Miscreated is by far the best early access post apocalyptic mmo on Steam(In my opinion). The developers are really passionate about making this game (unlike the developers of DayZ who make their game worse with every update). Miscreateds environment is amazing. It feels like an apocalypse actually occured and you want to explore it to see all it has to offer. You can tell they were inspired by the Fallout series and this is probably as close as were going to get to a Fallout Online game. The player interactions are always fun and unpredictable and can lead to some crazy situations. Theres also tons to do. You can pvp, kill mutants, loots houses, trailers, buildings and more, craft weapons, build bases, fix up vehicles to drive and explore the map to find fallout shelters and caves. This game is worthy of your $20. So give it go, you won't regret it ;).

I blew up my friend standing on some gas cannisters, then I caught on fire and became the human torch for like 20 minutes. 10/10 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GHbisZTqS4E

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI love this genre plus I love early access testing, but I have to shout out to fellow gamers that even EA games have stages. Miscreated is on a very early stage, I highly recommend buying it but keep in mind it needs a lot of work for it to be in a playable condition. At the moment you only get like 2-3 hours before boredom. Maybe you got excited about the graphics but that's just cryengine in effect, you will realize that graphics performance plus server issues destroy your overall experience. At the moment you have only few items to loot, no grouping system, a pretty weak anti-cheat system and the zombies are kinda useless. What really hurts the game is the slow development team posting a minor patch now and then without any extra content. I remember another game going this way..

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been looking for a game like this for ages, all i can say is that this is perfect. I only played it for two hours so far and it made a good first impression. 1) I didn't get shot on sight after meeting several groups of people. 2) I have experienced no bugs. 3) The loot system seems pretty good. 4) realistic graphics. 5) The food and water system does not run out to fast, which is fantastic. Also you don't get wrecked by millions of zombies, making the game impossible like some others, although obviously this is an apocalyptic game so you should stumble upon some zombies like i did, which is good. I recommend this game 100%!

After consulting every ressource I know before purchasing ONE and only ONE survival game, I've been attracted by the visuals of Miscreated at once. The concept of the game and the motivation of the developpers did the rest and I purchased it.
Now, after few die and retries, I'm positively surprised to still find new things to do. The randomisation of the equipement conditions your experience and makes it different each time. Once you'll find guns at once and look for a fight, another day it'll be harder and will have to craft your spiked plank.
The incoming content looks promising, the cooperation will be a must to achieve great things and carry the materials with your pickup to the construction site of your base.
Last but not least, I think the game is more friendly" than other games of this kind with simplified controls and UI.

So far

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At the time of this review, I am a developer of this game.

This game has heaps of potential. And the team strives to reach that potential by updating the game with more content on a well timed basis.

Yes, the game has its flaws such as connectivity issues, lack of certain gameplay elements and others. But you have to understand that it's still in Alpha. I'm not trying to use that as an excuse but it's a valid argument due to the fact that are about 14 people working hard to give you guys results.

A lot of people have mentioned that there aren't a lot of things to do in the game -- but I've noticed that those reviews usually have less than 1 hour of gameplay.

The game definitely requires patience if you want to enjoy it. Finding loot isn't a chore as there's houses and buildings usually containing a few items here and there. The scenery of the game really makes exploring it worthwhile. Combat is pretty difficult but very thrilling. Definitely recommend teaming up with friends to take on other players. Mutants are scarce in some areas but thriving in others (such as Pinecrest or Sultan).

TL;DR

Play the game but give it time; 2 hours or less isn't going to cut it.
Get some friends or go solo, you'll face thrills either way.
If you don't want to get it now, at least be sure to keep an eye on it because a lot of features are
going to be improved and implemented in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like the game and totaly recommend it to all people who loves the postapocalyptic survival genre. What I like the most about the game is its love for the mapdesign. The mapdesign and all things with it is just so freaking awesome, I've never seen so much love for details in any of the other survival multiplayer games. It really feels like being in a postapocalyptic world. Houses are old, plants growing over the walls, textures are well done, with grafity of the last ones, rubbish glittering over floors and stuff... I think that is quite important to get the right impressions! The map is alrdy quite big too and they working on it and make it bigger from time to time. But it never feels like you walking from one point to another for ages like I have experienced in other survival games. The looting system is well done as well. You literally find things everywhere. You just have to search in particular to get things together.

The second I like very much ist the pvp part. You dont need to wait very long to get into decent pvp. There are 3 bigger towns and an airfield which is famous for its pvp. The weapon system still needs some work but it feels very well done already. The weapons are not that overpowered, especially the snipers, you really have to have a calm hand to hit somebody. Its not like in other games where snipers just laying in a hedges for hours and oneshot all the poor guys who trying to find loot and they actually dont know what just happened. Most of the time its more like, you hear a shot and quite quick you know you are under fire, so you rush into cover, a building or whatsoever... then the fun part begins. The moment you hear steps and you know somebody hostile wants you to be dead. Your heartbeat slowly increases. It can take a while after the actual fight starts because everybody know, If I loose this fight, I gotta start from scratch. Those moments can be so intense... I love it!

The third part is the basebuilding... holy ♥♥♥♥ it makes so much fun. You can build so beautiful shelter, little block houses, bases as little roadblocks or even really big forts where u store all your vehicles and in future the storage crates. You find your guides for the different parts and then you start to build your home, just the way you want it to look like. No predefined blocks. The basebuilding system is made a way that every base has its unique look.

Overall I like the fact it is held pretty realistic. In groups you are really have to remember what your mates look like or he ends up friendly fired by yourself. There is no crosshair with any weapon which helps for aiming. To get vehicles going you need to find several parts, like drivebelts, oil, spark plagues ect. Mutants can be really dangerous if you dont care. First you start on the map you are really lost and no magic map is showing you where you actually are. So you gotta find out yourself what is where, where to go and so on...

The game itself being in an alpha state is already well done! Sure it has still tons of bugs and things to be made better in future, lot of features and content to implement into the game so its getting interesting for a long term fungame but the devs working on it and they let you know they do quite often.

I think the game has a lot of potential and being said I was never a big fan of its genre, for this particular game I want to be a part of its development and would like to see how it turns out in the end. If devs keeping up the good work on it, it will blow a lot of poeples minds!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Review for Miscreated My rating:  9/10
I want to start off by saying that Miscreated is better than any other open-world survival game that I know off.
Forget DayZ, forget Rust, forget H1Z1 because Miscreated is better in almost all aspects.

There isn't much backstory to the game, but it really doesn't need any at all. Here's the little story that is: The game is set in a world devastated by two nuclear wars. The radiation has left much of the population dead, and some have become sick and mutated.
Thats pretty much it.
You spawn in and you're free to raom the harsh but beautiful world. Currently the map is big, but not huge. You can walk across in about 15-20 mins, maybe less.

Let's do some pros and cons

Pros:
It's beautiful. I have only played this on a laptop, but I could set the graphic settings to high without experiencing any problems. I could even do very high but then I could encounter a few preformance issues wich i would rather not. If you just have an ok gaming pc, you should be able to run this on very high all arround. Compared to DayZ, where I couldn't even play on medium to low without major preformance issues, this is amazing. The game is no less vizually rewarding than others in its genre.

It has working viechles. The game offers 6 working viechles. Altough they might need fixing when you find them arround the wrold. Some of the components that can be missing from viecles are: Wheels, drive belt, battery, oil, diesel, spark plugs and so on. These items can be found arround the map, often in garages an such.

The game  features 18 different weapons. 9 firearms and 9 melee weapons. These are scattered arround teh world, but personally i found most of my guns at the airfield, where I encountered a 5-ton truck filled with weapons.

The building mechanics in the game are apparently very good, and altough I haven't yet tried it out myself I'm listing this as a pro, merely because the game containes building.

There is an in game map that you can find, equip and use. If you don't happen to find any just go  Here [miscreated.wikia.com] and check it out.

My general player encounter has been good and bad therefore this is listed as both a pro, and con. The good people I've met have been nice and even rolepaying too. They have both been friendly and hostile, but they havn't opend fire without any reason like the ones I'll talk about in the con section.

Crafting. I haven't really crafted much but it has potential to become even better than it is.
Cons:
Mutants. There are two different mutants in game, one that is basicly a regular peron gone mental, and one that has a spike for a hand. These are acctually quite rare, wich isn't necesarily a bad thing, but it would deffinatly raise the difficulty if they were more common. They can be kiled with 3 hits from an axe, but take 13 punches so don't fistfight them.

Player encounters. Ovbiously there are no rules against killing, looting and such, but it would really make the game more enjoyable for all if people with good gear didn't just kill anyone on sight. But ovbiously in all games where it's allowed, there will always be people killing for the heck of it, so all in all, similar to the real world.

Inventory system. Now this isn't really a negative thing. Honestly there is nothing wrong with it. I just personally prefer a tetris-inventory were items take bigger place depending on how big they acctually are. This game does feature a weight system though, so you can't carry  everything you come across. Also backpacks aren't that common.

Player glitch. This might just be me but I sometimes have problems viewing my players arms, legs and torso. this is only if I don't have clothes covering it up. My head and lower legs is usually visible. My friend didn't encounter the same issue and he saw my character without the glitch. this is a minor problem but kind of annoying when i had to tear my clothes to rags for healing and was left looking at a half-invisible charater for a while.
I would stronly reccomend this game if you are tired of other half-♥♥♥♥♥ survival games. This is a game that provides great fun and a challenge. The devs updates it regularly.
This game gets a 9/10 from me. I am looking froward to see how it evolves in the future upon release.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI'm mixed on the Alpha version of the game.  Great environment, chilling undead, and fun investing the area. If you like PVP, you will like the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is in Alpha testing as of this review.

The game itself is great, great potential, great concept, and believable end of the world scenario.
The problem is the players.
There are PVE servers, or so the claim to be PVE. Which is great, because I really don't care for PVP. Not that I don't mind pvp games, but, when a server is listed as PVE it should be PVE.
The problem is that there are those out there that pretend to be friendly, you know push f2 to show hands raised or wave as if they are friendly, then when your back is turned they shoot and loot. This has happened to me multiple times on different pve servers. Since this game is very realistic with health dropping rapidly once you get shot there really isn't anything you can do but bleed out and start over, or become a raider yourself. The game really devolves into 2-4 man groups killing eachother for petty supplies, no matter which server you are on.

Gameplay is fantastic, but everyone becomes a hunter or the prey, don't kid yourself into thinking you can be friendly in this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The most easily noticed difference between this survival game and the others is the gorgeous world you can explore. Everything from the run down and overgrown homes, supermarkets, gas stations, and churches all have a post-apocalyptic feel and look stunning. My modest PC runs it at max settings without issue (i7-3770 and a Strix GTX 960).

The second thing I noticed (but arguably the most important IMHO) is how much noticeably friendlier everyone is compared to DayZ. Of course there is still the occasional ♥♥♥♥♥♥ bag that kills you on sight but 9 times out of 10 the people you encounter won't bother you, and may even help you if you ask nicely.

Overall it certainly has my recommendation after a handful of hours in the game. It has bugs and sometimes it crashes but at its core I think it is already more refined than DayZ and offers a more fun (albiet currently more limited) experience for someone looking for a good survival game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is what DayZ Standalone is trying to be, this is what DayZ Standalone should have been. But you've either got what it takes, or you haven't and Miscreated has it all. The graphics , the sound effects, even the weather effects, everything about this game is just so beautifully crafted to give you a fully immersive experience that will leave you wishing all games were developed with the Cryengine! (When the machines take over, they're going to use Cryengine to plug us into the Matrix, mark my words.. You won't know the difference!).

Edit: I need to add to my original review, that the KoS in this game is exactly if not worse than DayZ. It's getting boring already, there's no fun in being KoS'd by the ONLY other player on the server.  Once you've been KoS'd a few times in a game like this, it just turns into a grind each time you have to respawn (it took hours each time for me), spend a few hours gearing up, get kos'd, rinse, repeat .. Honestly though, I still love this game, the devs work hard at keeping it fresh and it's still way ahead of DayZ Standalone and the likes. Just wish it would attract a more mature (or just old school bandit, if that's your thing) type of player!

If you don't like the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t KoS kiddy mentality of DayZ , then don't buy this game (the island is too small to avoid bumping into each other, even when there's only 2 of you on), KoS seems to be a part of this gaming genre these days! You can't escape it!

Definately a game you play with a clan for protection, but as a solo PVE experience? No.

When I play games like this (with rampant KoS) I start to lose faith in humanity! Because when it boils down to it,  these games prove that in a world without law or order, the majority of people are just nasty ♥♥♥♥♥! The morons are outbreading the rest of us, this is how it ends!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe few hours I've played I was very impressed. This is what DayZ should have been. Game is beautifal and runs very smoothly. I have a middle-low end computer and did not experience any lag or frame drop even when going into big towns running on Nvidia Gforce GTX 555 4g. Base building has just been introduced I havent tried it yet and there are a few vehichles you can drive around. My first play through I was beat to death by 2 bandits while looting. AI mutants arent the smartest thing but I'm sure they will be improved over time. The weather system is amazing! I first joined in the middle of what seemed like a hurricane storm. I could barely see anything and the rain effects were amazing! Players are active aswell. I had no problem finding a high population server. Max players right now is 36 i think. The detail put into all the structures aswell is great. You definately feel like your looting through a ravaged post apocolyptic map complete with bone piles and RUN OR DIE!" graffiti everywhere. Only problem I had was finding ammo. Found a total of 3 pistols the entire time and only 1 mag for 1 of them. This is after looting the airfield there. It really puts stress on wether to use your bullets or not. Definatley worth the $20
date: I can't wait to see the finished product after seeing what they have accomplished so far!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very fun game, realistic (minus the bugs) and has huge potential with the added features coming in patches.

Whitelist servers are a fantastic idea to prevent trolls, hackers and griefers from ruining everyone's ability to enjoy the game.  Most normal servers are ruined by griefer trolls who get bored of getting fragged on PVP servers so come to prey on friendly players.  so, not unlike every online game out there.

Price reduction or server population reduction for user-run servers would be much appreciated!

Highly recommend!

Pros:

Cons:

Would i recommend this game?

YES
(as compaired to dayZ this has developed alot in short time,hoping to get things fixed soon otherwise game might become repetitive.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Good
----------

- Nice graphics

- Great gameplay

- Runs smooth as a baby's ♥♥♥

- Awesomme community (havent been KOS 5 hours in)

- Loot system works well and more logically than in other games imo

- No hackers

- Smaller map than most survivals out there(for now), to me this is a plus since i get to meet friends easier (no more running 3 hours to meet buddies)

- IMMERSIVE, this is a big plus for me, the use of the flashlight at night, in old abandonnned graffiti house's or spotting other players from a far with their lights, or seeing animals move around, hearing flies near bodies and garbage's, etc...

The Bad
---------

- The mutants, not only are they not scary, seems like they all look the same and are completely brainless. (im pretty sure this will change upon release.

- Cannot host your own server, i wish this would change, probably get more people interested in the product but i think that is why there are no hackers for now.

- The gunshots sound like ♥♥♥♥

Verdict
-------

Yes i recommend the game, it works better than dayz and H1Z1 imo.

This flew under my radar at first for a while, plus de publicity doesnt look amazing and looks more like a dayz clone than anything but believe me its well worth it. Dev's, change the miscreated logo and store front and get this game seen by more people because this is great work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At time of writing 11th March 2016, the game doesn't have any base storage options, the game without storage is frustrating, no getting around that, but please read on.

The devs have said the reason for it is due to the Cryengine and they are having to rewrite a lot of code (which only one of the team can do), and so that will take time. They have said storage is coming.

Don't be put off too much though, the game is still excellent without storage, for some of the following reasons:
The graphics are superb
The game is logical - you find more food in kitchens for example
Vehicles are fun to drive...a truck going downhill on it's rims (no tyres) makes for a very interesting slippy experience! Slap some tyres on it and you have a fast, manoverable machine!
The dark is terrifying whether you are stalking players or being stalked - this can't be overstated enough and is a real treat to be involved with, especially if you are in a group!
There are plenty of KoS'ers, but also plenty of friendly players as well.
The price is very reasonable for what you get and the 'cost-per-hour' of fun you will get out of it!

Miscreated really does have the potential to be something very special, but it's not quite there yet.

Definitely worth 15 quid though!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction Welcome to Miscreated, A multiplayer, post-apocalyptic, survival-based game created with CryEngine, available on Steam and in Alpha stage.

Brief Overview Miscreated is a Survival Horror game based after the Final War, fought with the last of the belligerent nations’ nuclear stockpiles, and the ones who pulled the triggers didn’t survive. Civilization is taking a Breather in 2089, anyone left alive and unmutated is just focused on staying that way, Survival of the Fittest.

Game Play Miscreated shows basic gameplay, however encounters with other players gets your heart pounding then you are left with a decision on whether to trust them or not and this is where Miscreated shines its brightest with the social interaction between other players. The Mutants need some work but now cause some chaotic interactions with the new AI they were given. Loot is rare and gives you a sensation when you find that handcrafted pistol hidden underneath a table. The character you play as handle's surpisingly stable, however due to the game being in alpha the controls can be buggy at some points throughout the game.

In Game Graphics The graphics in Miscreated are incredible, whether its from shining your flashlight into windows, watching the sun shine brightly over the hills or walking into houses with fascinating overgrowth. CryEngine makes Miscreated one of a kind and well worth investing into it's alpha.

Sound  Miscreated currently doesn't have an in-game soundtrack but it does have a beautiful melodic main menu theme song.
Miscreated also uses it's in game sound effects as a tension builder throughout the game.

Pro's And Con's  + Heart pounding gameplay
+ Amazing in-game graphics
+ Not much k.o.s
+ Base Building
+ Constant Updates

- under-populated servers
- Bugs

Conclusion  Miscreated works very well as an alpha and is well worth $20.00. We all need to work together as a community and expand Miscreated's playerbase, as Miscreated has the potential of being something huge!

2 options : shoot the 8 rounds at the driver / drop the gun and raise both hands up hoping he would stop and we could venture together.
Picked the second variant.
Got ran over.

I am still preparing myself to open the game once more.

11/10 SHOOT THE DRIVERS !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction Welcome to Miscreated, A multiplayer, post-apocalyptic, survival-based game created with CryEngine, available on Steam and in Alpha stage.

Brief Overview Miscreated is a Survival Horror game based after the Final War, fought with the last of the belligerent nations’ nuclear stockpiles, and the ones who pulled the triggers didn’t survive. Civilization is taking a Breather in 2089, anyone left alive and unmutated is just focused on staying that way, Survival of the Fittest.

Game Play Miscreated shows basic gameplay, however encounters with other players gets your heart pounding then you are left with a decision on whether to trust them or not and this is where Miscreated shines its brightest with the social interaction between other players. The Mutants need some work but now cause some chaotic interactions with the new AI they were given. Loot is rare and gives you a sensation when you find that handcrafted pistol hidden underneath a table. The character you play as handle's surpisingly stable, however due to the game being in alpha the controls can be buggy at some points throughout the game.

In Game Graphics The graphics in Miscreated are incredible, whether its from shining your flashlight into windows, watching the sun shine brightly over the hills or walking into houses with fascinating overgrowth. CryEngine makes Miscreated one of a kind and well worth investing into it's alpha.

Sound  Miscreated currently doesn't have an in-game soundtrack but it does have a beautiful melodic main menu theme song.
Miscreated also uses it's in game sound effects as a tension builder throughout the game.

Pro's And Con's  + Heart pounding gameplay
+ Amazing in-game graphics
+ Not much k.o.s
+ Base Building
+ Constant Updates

- under-populated servers
- Bugs

Conclusion  Miscreated works very well as an alpha and is well worth $20.00. We all need to work together as a community and expand Miscreated's playerbase, as Miscreated has the potential of being something huge!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have Played Miscreated, for 4 months. I know it is early access. The attention to detail is Brilliant. And with every new patch, new and more effects are being added. In is nice to see the developers, take such a interest in the game, and the players, who play the game. It has a fantastic game engine (CryENGINE). For me, I can go on any Server, in the world, ie (UK to USA or Australia) with almost no lag. And with new things in the pipeline, Base building is coming. The game is a,  joy to play. With each Update, that comes out New things are added, some more of the map is opened up, a big cave (which is very well done), and tweaks, to improve the game. Plus the New Crytech engine update, which give better Graphics, and shading. Update Base Building is in game now, and very easy to build, a basic base. Since I got this game, a lot has been added. With such a small Devopment team, this game has, what they have added in the last 6 months ( is Brilliant) A great game. Worth getting, with a lot to come, ie: Battle Royale in the Pipeline. 2016 is going to be a good year for this game & the players. Update: There is a New City being added sometime this year (2016), should be a big plus. And now the Weather, The Rain Tornado, is Brilliant. One thing about this game, you never know, what will be added next.
