reviewText:
Early Access Review

Miscreated is an immersive and beautiful apocalypse experience. Even with a map 1/4th the size of DayZ's it still feels very expansive in it's current state, and even Miscreated being an Early-Access release it plays with minimal bugs for me. Lack of content is the only downfall I have noticed so far.. which should be expected during the Alpha stage of development.


Overall Opinion:   9.8/10

I feel Miscreated is on it's way to being a great game with developers that pay attention to detail and consider player suggestions, unlike other survival apocalypse titles here on Steam (*coughcough*H1Z1*cough*). For only $10 out of my wallet for a high-quality game Miscreated get's a two thumbs up from me.

The game needs more content .... especially crafting for survival and/or base building.

I have played H1Z1 A LOT and this game can beat it but it needs more attention from its developers.

I'm excited for this game's potential and I will continue to play and help the developers.
I'm excited for the future of this game!

Im aware i only have just shy of 6 hours playtime, and i have to admit the houses and places can become a little bit repetitive, i just believe this game has huge potential and is already 100% worth the £14.99 price tag :)

I very much look forward to them adding more and more to the game in the future!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is a pretty nice alternative if you liked Dayz or Standalone but want to play something being devolved a lot faster and better. It does not have as much variation or the same amount of content but the team is definitely active and trying their best to make the game as good as they can. Updates are pretty constant with a full list of what’s been changed and added. I know early Access games are a pain in the ♥♥♥♥ sometimes and don’t get me wrong, there are bugs and it’s not perfect, but my personal experience so far has been pretty solid. They also have a pretty nice community, which is a plus in any game. If you want to give it a go and if you are a pretty open minded person, knowing that it’s not 100% perfect yet, then give it a go and see what’s up, otherwise wait till full release. I personally think this game is going places and I really hope the Devs keep up their amazing work. Also to the Miscreated team, if you guys need an artist for any promotional stuff or posters, hit me up!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI could be wrong but I think most of the negative reviews are from when the game was first released. I can't comment on these as I only bought the game about 3 weeks ago and have roughly 30 hours in game. I really like this game and have had alot of fun playing it. Having played Dayz Standalone, Rust, H!Z! and just about every other zombie apocolypse / survivial game out there I can honestly say this is my favourite and the one I would recommend to others to get into the genre. This game really stands apart from others, it looks beautiful, has alot of features already in the game and has so much potential. Add to that an active Dev team with regular updates / announcements / telling us what the plan is and you have a very solid early access game. Zombies , PvP, PvE, Basbuilding, Crafting and more to come, I would definately recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am writing a review for this game, because I feel the 'mixed' rating it has does not do it justice.

I'll start by saying, a long time ago I played the Day Z mod for Arma II and enjoyed that.    I have never played the stand alone version of Day Z as people warned me off buying that due to nothing being updated in it, and it taking a turn for the worse or being somewhat broken.

This game, while still in Alpha as I write this, is giving me those addictive nostalgic feelings from when Day Z was actually good, plus it has more stuff in it (base building/crafting).

The developers actually seem to care about this, and release regular updates/fixes.    It looks to be going in a really good direction.

TLDR:  If you enjoyed Arma II Day Z mod, you'll love this to bits.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I actually like the progress this game has made of the past months. First off I must say this game is huge. It runs fairly well and framerates have gotten better. The new lightning/fog mechanics give a greater ambience to the game. Visually it is more appealing then other survival horrors.  Basebuilding is fun yet simple. Weapons are hard to come by as they should be. Crafting has gotten alot better.  The flashlight along with night time adds another element to the game.



One thing I will say is how the car/vehicle mechanics work. The fact that all cars start with nothing in them is a bit of a pain. Finding one tire on the map let alone four is quite the task. Perhaps the cars should spawn with all tires and add a mechanic that enables the tires to be shot and blown out. In a nut shell, I ended up spending four hours looking for car supplies and ended up with 2 tires and spark plugs, half a tank of gas, battery and and oil. Point is it took me far too long to the point where I just wanted to give up. I still to this point have yet to get in a working vehicle and have only encountered 2 and a handful of bicycles which were recently added.

Another thing, which im sure has been mentioned and will be addressed is the Mutant rate/AI.  They have gotten alot better but are honestly almost do not exist in the game. Its to a point where I do not even fear them. Perhaps make them a bit tougher and have a better range of sight. Make them run the same speed as the survivors that way they are more cautious around them instead of simply running by knowing they wont catch them. I have actually seen a few players run around purposely having them chase them collecting several (5-10) and make a game out of it. While comical, I don't think the Mutant's AI were made as a joke.

All in all, this game has alot of promise and I enjoy what has become of it in the early development. The sky is the limit, Kudos the developers for sticking to it. Will continue to play. I baught a 4 pack for myself and friends so I am hoping convince them to continue giving Miscreated a chance.

8/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is absolutely great. I have 300 hours on h1z1 and 400 on DayZ. This game is much more playable then either one. If you're looking for a zombie survival game. This is it. The loot is pretty balanced but it could be a little harder But it's not that bad. The atmosphere is absolutely amazing. Things are overgrown. And it really feels like apocalypse. The performance is great and the graphics are absolutely beautiful everything is really screenshot worthy. The only con is it is a Early access game. Which means bugs and incomplete features. But honestly. With that being Said it us very playable. Lastly, the community. Its great. You'll find some people who want to just shoot you really depends where you are(Airfield and Pinecrest are not great social places lol). But a lot of people are really friendly and trying to help. I strongly recommend this over any other EA zombie survival game.

Early Access Review

First hour playing
Too scared to loot houses because a Zombie had surprise attacked me out of the shadows.
Running out of water, food.
Hear an ATV. Freak out and duck into the brush.
Someone types  Is anyone here"
It's too dark to see in the dark
date: but I'm too scared to be seen with a flashlight.\nI panic.\nI type that I'm new
hoursPlayed:
and will die within seconds if I do not have water.
We determine that we're both friendly.
He drops a Water Bottle. I am 14% health. I thank him for saving me.
I need to meet my brother. He says he's in a town I never have heard of.
The ATV man says that he doesn't know where it is
voteText:
but that we'll find it together.
He tells me that he can tell I'm Canadian. We laugh. He jokes that he should kill me.
I believe him.
He laughs.
Most of the ride on the back of the ATV is spent in silence as I look around at the twilight - I guess it added to the sense of realism..It's not like you can clearly hear people while going full-speed on the highway. It takes about ten minutes.
I get to my destination.
He screams " YOU'VE GOT A ZOMBIE BEHIND YOU!"
I run around in circles. I don't know what else to do. I get on the back of his ATV again.
He drives away
helpfulPercent:
but for some reason I jump off.
Zombie kills me.
I feel bad that he spent all this time driving me somewhere only for me to die at my destination.
I log off.

Thanks ATV man from Finland. I'm sorry."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros-
Beautiful, exhilarating, optimized, entertaining, great building system, great loot, logical locations, well structure map, RELATIVELY friendly community (not as much kill on sight bull as DayZ), smooth pvp (not clunky), good voice communication, three chats (area, local, whisper),
I' havn't dropped below 60 fps unless loading which is great for a game that requires on the spot decision making (especially when in a firefight)
I have not played in a group or clan yet, I assume it's fun and hope to find some groups to hang with. But as of right now I cannot really comment on team play for this game.
The Devs are really interactive and value community opinion very highly, this is honestly amazing. They update frequently which doesn't make me question where my money is going, or if this game will finish, because I'm certain it will

Cons-
Buggy AI (although I've heard this will be fixed)
Very simplistic inventory overlay
Not a whole lot of content YET.

Overall if you would like to play a great game, and watch it grow both in content and community, buy this game, and if you enjoy it recommend it to a friend!
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For someone who has seen all sorts of Zombie Survival Games, this game is, by far, the best attempt at doing it right and a refreshing restart.

+ Super Fluid and Optimized Game Engine
+ Beautiful Vegetation/Environment
+ Exceptionally well done modeling & texturing
+ Very good loot system (you actually have to use a flashlight to find everything!)
+ Rewarding exploring

- Minor bugs
- Inventory System
- AI
- Server List

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFirst off, beautiful graphics! Anyways this is the most well put together, realistic, massive multiplayer game out there! H1Z1 was an atrocious survival game like no one has room to disagree because it turned into a stupid deathmatch game for crying out loud....DayZ Standalone is good but has too many OP weapons, but Miscreated now is a game that makes you feel like you're really in an apocalypse. The houses in miscreated are all different and have vegetation and wear all on and INSIDE the houses, every house and i mean EVERY house varies like its incredible how much work they put into the houses unlike in H1Z1 and DayZ. Next is the weapons. Yes, there aren't many weapons but there are some weapons that actually might be found in towns like a simple hand gun or beaten winchester or huniting rifle (which is super rare), ammo is super hard to find like it really would be in real life which helps lower the D-Bags in the game and really makes people want to make a group instead of kill on sight. Best zombie game yet, runs like a charm, and is definitely worth the money!

Early Access Review

First hour playing
Too scared to loot houses because a Zombie had surprise attacked me out of the shadows.
Running out of water, food.
Hear an ATV. Freak out and duck into the brush.
Someone types  Is anyone here"

date: but I'm too scared to be seen with a flashlight.\nI panic.\nI type that I'm new
hoursPlayed:
and will die within seconds if I do not have water.
We determine that we're both friendly.

I need to meet my brother. He says he's in a town I never have heard of.
The ATV man says that he doesn't know where it is
voteText:
but that we'll find it together.
He tells me that he can tell I'm Canadian. We laugh. He jokes that he should kill me.
I believe him.
He laughs.
Most of the ride on the back of the ATV is spent in silence as I look around at the twilight - I guess it added to the sense of realism..It's not like you can clearly hear people while going full-speed on the highway. It takes about ten minutes.
I get to my destination.

I run around in circles. I don't know what else to do. I get on the back of his ATV again.
He drives away

I log off.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best survival games to date with a great community behind it and a very regular player base .
The devs do an amazing job and are constantly active providing regular updates that benefit the game and the way its played .
You also cannot fail to notice the landscape around you while you play Miscreated its both visually stunning in appearance and practical when it comes to running ( yea i do that a lot ) and finding cover usually from bandits .                                                                                                                           This game has everything - great graphics , good weapons and loot , wild animals roaming the forests , swamps , lakes and ponds plus rivers full of fish .
The game also has base building its easy to pick up and with a little work there is no end to what you can make .
Miscreated also has plenty of vehicles to drive , towns and villages to visit ( soon be a city ) and an awesome day and night cycle .

Miscreated is very polished and should be on your list of survival games to play

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hi Luthias bringing you a recommendation

Miscreated is one of the most beautiful games ive ever played.
Please support the developers. They are working hard and theres
enough piracy killing the future of great gaming. I looked at Day-Z,
H1Z1, Nether and more and found to my delight Miscreated.

The weather effects with a headset gives me a real feeling that
ive only felt in real life camping in the wild. The sounds are perfect
and you get nervous walking around at night with other players
looking around on bikes and trucks. Hiding in the bushes till they
move on is thrilling and the sounds the mutants make gets you
all flustered looking in every direction. Map size is perfect and gives
you a real island feeling.

Servers are still a bit quiet so please jump on this bus while you can
the players are friendly and survival is real. Enjoy. 10/10

I hope this review was helpful to you in your decision!

Very easily to stockpile both and get bored and start PKing, would be much more tense if I also had to worry about not dying from starvation and dehydration.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Optimization: 10/10
This game is beautiful, arguably better looking than most early access games, yet it runs really really well!  I can play on high settings with a rock solid 60FPS.

Graphics: 9/10
In addition to the beautiful lighting/visuals, there's also tons of small details throughout the map that make it look even better.  Rats and flies around trash, birds flying around while chirping, etc.  Some things (rats, car tires) need animations but even without them they look great.  Distant objects could use a little work, though.

Gameplay: 8/10
While it may be in early stages, it still has more than most other survival games have.  There aren't too many mutants, but also not too little - the difficulty is just right.  The looting system could use a bit more work, making it easier to tell if something is lootable could help since it's easy to walk past something.  Gunplay feels really smooth, first and third person modes look great, and the gameplay itself is just fun.


Things I don't like:
- Server browser could use some work, same goes for the menus in general.  Server browser needs favorites and histoy tabs to make finding previous servers easy, and maybe bump up the font size a bit. The inventory is perfectly fine, though.
- Lack of players.  This game isn't dead, there's always servers with ~20 people on, but there could always be some more people, which isn't exactly the developers fault, just the lack of people being aware of this game.  The community is really nice, though.
- Lack of mutant/zombie/whatever variety.  This isn't really major but should be adressed later on.

tl;dr: If you want a solid survival game that runs really well while looking beautiful, this is the way to go.  Developers are really active with the community and seem really nice, while playerbase is small it isn't toxic.  Fun game!

Graphically gorgeous, runs extremely well for an early access, good frame rates, no lag or glitching.

Working vehicles in game which you have to find parts for before running.  Quad bikes, trucks, baggage  carriers, tractors and boats!  Am loving it.

We have explored caves, died of radiation poisoning, chased and attacked by mutants and crafted an FahQ bat!  Awesome!

Developers are working on base building which is looking great followed by hunting and cooking.  Cannot wait to get my camp built with friends.

What are you waiting for?  Join the community and come exploring, surviving and have the odd fight here and there with other players.  You won't regreat picking this game up, it is only going to get better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Miscreated places you in a survival world which balances perfectly between the arcade-style of H1Z1 and the hardcore feel of DayZ.

Whether you're looking for a casual survival game in which you can just jump on for 20 or so minutes to grab a gun and hunt for a few easy kills, or a hardcore survival game where you wish to spend hours building and fortifying a base and gathering a crew, this is the game for you. You can almost literally make this game whatever you want it to be, pick a server to go and commit banditry and just have a bit of fun, or pick a server to practically live on, one which you will continue to revisit due to the community that has been built on it, and the friends and/or enemies you might acquire.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I dont usually leave reviews, however, I feel compelled to leave one for this under-rated gem of a game.
I was looking for a post apocalyptic survival experience, and saw Miscreated on sale, so I went and took a risk and bought it, even after a friend of mine had recommended I didnt because they played months ago and didn't find it that good.

I do not regret buying this game at all, it surpassed my every expectation, to the point I feel a review wouldn't justify my experience enough. Instead I'll write about my second play through (because I died pretty quick by bleeding out the first time)

I began in the middle of nowhere, literally. I ran through a forest for about ten fifteen minutes, and just when I thought I would die from thirst, I found a small village. Armed with nothing but my flashlight (which you will need at night) I began exploring this small village.
After searching a couple of houses, I really felt like this was a world that had ended, people had clearly lived in these houses at some point. From the photographs on the walls to the leaking toilets and the childrens bedrooms.
As i observed the wallpaper peeling from the walls and struggled to find any decent still edible food, I heard a groan outside.
Grabbing some dog food i slowly approached the outside of the house i was in, and after looking around for a while I saw it.
A mutant.
Feeling safe, I decided to try and sneak by into the next house, hoping to find a weapon.
The mutant heard my footsteps on the grass and ran after me, so i started to flee.
In a panic i could hear its footsteps behind me slowly fade and upon turning around could see the mutant walking away back towards the village.
I followed slowly and quietly and explored some more houses.
One house i went in had a couch completely covered in blood with a skeleton lying on the floor. What happened here?
I went up the stairs, found a change of clothes and some antibiotics, along with a bag to carry more stuff and a beanie hat to keep my head warm.
I went into the attic where I found a rifle and a few rounds.
Yes, now it was safe to go outside and confront the mutant.
NO IT WASN'T.
After shooting the mutant and missing the headshot, it ran at me. I pumped another round into its face and it dropped lifeless in front of me.
Oh crap, I was hungry and thirsty, time to eat and drink.
I barely got chance to consume the little food I had picked up when I heard more sounds. More mutants where coming.
The gunshot had attracted them, before I could figure out where to run it was too late, I died.
This was my first hour or two experiencing the game, and I hadnt even came accross a real life player yet.
It was a very tense experience to say the least, and really felt like a post apocalyptic world, from as little as the odd flashing light to the ability to repair cars after finding parts and building bases, this is the game I would recommend, over dayz any day.
The graphics are beautiful too.

I ran this on an AMD A10 processor with integrated radeon r7 graphics, so not even a graphics card in my machine at the minute. It ran perfectly fine on medium settings and even with some settings turned to high, If you want it to run with everything on extra high without a little lag you may need a half decent graphics card though.

I highly recommend this game, and with it constantly improving, I can not wait to see what else the developers have in store.

The best advice I can give is ignore any reviews and try it yourself, of course it isn't perfect with it still being early access...... but it isn't far off.

oh, and don't get comfortable thinking you're safe, you are never safe.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an early access title.

+ Cryengine = yeah !!
+ survival game = yeah !!

- connecting to a server can take long / if you manage to get on a server that is.
Often the client get's stuck while synching, or it just throws you back to the serverlist
- performance drop in fps compared to other titles with the cryengine / get's hopefully ironed out.

Due to it's an early access game and the lack of actual playtime, due to the above issues, i can not give an accurate review of this game.
It's based on my first impression, and you might not run into the same problems as i did.
I will change my review, either once progress has been made, or at a later point when the game has reached release date.

Verdict:
Buying this game is a gamble, like any other early access title !

?/ 10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Amazing game! Not sure why it has mixed reviews. I have 300 hours on it at this point and plan to have many more. Every time I play I run into a heart pounding situation. Like literally, heart pounding. The graphics and lighting are top notch. The map is a good size, and is getting bigger. The patches come out frequently, and are quite sizable.

And the combat is so gritty.

The base building! It's awesome. You start off with basic crafting. And you can find more recipes to create more advanced things. For instance, I can make a small generator that powers 5 flood lights. The Devs say they are going to be adding more stuff to power as well.

There are vehicles in game and to get them going you need to repair them. Tires, fuel, oil, spark plugs, drive belt, battery. It's pretty rewarding when you get one going and can rip around with your buddies.

I've tried lots of other survival games and this one is the first and only one that has me hopelessly addicted :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here is a story.

So I spawn at the Military Base. My buddy and I both spawned after a wipe.

I go and loot the military base, but I find nothing great.

But I did see a Truck with 4 wheels, and a battery. Hmm, this could be good. I tell my buddy about it.

So I go to meet up with my buddy at Sultan, and we go back to the Military Base to fix up the truck, my buddy had a Spark Plug, and Oil, but no Diesel Fuel.

On the way to the Military Base, we find a player inside a house. We try robbing him but he didn't talk. My buddy shot him with a Wasteland .22 I gave him. He had Diesel Fuel on him, great! Now we can finish fixing the truck.

While we approched the Military Base, we heard someone. We didn't know where he was. It sounded like he was speaking Spanish.

We ran for the truck, and on the way my buddy saw him up on a watch tower. He didn't shoot.

We get to the truck and start fixing it, but an armed player comes along. My buddy tries holding him up but he just runs away. Probably got scared because there were 2 of us.

Anyway, we fix the truck, and drive away from the Military Base, and hear the Spanish guy saying something.

We stop and loot some houses, and while we are looting them, I say: I bet someone is going to come here and take the truck without noticing me in the 2nd seat."

We laugh at the possibility of having that happen

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you like survival games, dont mind dying alot, and can stand to build a floating base full of trucks simply for storage space, then this is the game for you!!! Why a floating base, you might ask. Players. Axes. Period. Why use trucks as storage? No storage. That being said, with 300+ hours logged, I can safely say that this game is on its way to being a powerhouse in the survival genre. There are still some pretty hellacious bugs, but they do not occur with any regularity, and are sure to be ironed out eventually. Just sucks when they do hit ya. Trucks (particularly the orange pickup trucks) may teleport you out into the ocean beyond the world boundy; you may just be running and fall through the world; or you may disconnect while driving and log in only to find a possessed demon truck waiting to murder you. And yes, this means you lose all of your ...stuff. But, as I said, those are fairly rare occurances. Game mechanics are solid, environment looks beautiful, and its just generally addicting. I'm looking forward to a good too many more hours burned on this game. Recommended.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Last Review Update: April 27, 2016

Review of Early Access version

===

Rating 7/10 - Good

===

Pros & Cons

+ Pros +

+ Very good atmosphere and graphics, it will make you really feel inside an apocalypse, especially at night time.
+ Well recreated environments and cities
+ Finding good loot is very hard and will take you a lot of time
+ You have to look for recipes to craft more advanced things, enhanching exploration and discovery
+ Solid base building system with traps, barricades, walls and accessory structures
+ Zombies are a real threat, unlike in other similar games, and will kill you if you are not prepared
+ Environment hazards like radiations, tornadoes, lightning storms and also starvation / dehydration are serious threats and make the game experience deeper and harder
+ Overall stable net code and servers
+ Not many bugs for being an Early Access, unlike many other games which are a full of bugs
+ Group system


- Cons -

- Overall very limited variety of Weapons, Clothing, Foodstuff and Accessories
- Clunky and choppy animations for most things
- No buildable containers to store items in bases, only Vehicles can be used for that purpose currently
- Many graphical minor bugs
- You cannot sort ammunitions out of magazines, or vice-versa.
- Zombies are often few and scattered around, no hordes" as you would expect in a proper apocalypse
- Vehicles can currently drive without wheels with no penalty to speed or manuvrability
- Ugly invisible barriers around the map prevent players from going further
date:
something like radiations would have been a lot better
- Temperature currently has no effect on a Player's health whatsoever

===

I think this game has potential to become the perfect mix between Rust and DayZ. It is very good despite its alpha stutus. It is fun and can be played also alone but with friends is better.


"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I bought this game, it was sitting with a Mixed Review of 4800+. I have spent 12 hours in this game and it has potential. Its a mix between H1Z1, DayZ Standalone, Rust, and the Epoch Mod for the Arma games.

My big complaint is the size of the map. Small, when you think about it. I am use to a huge open world game, like Arma and H1Z1. This being said, its still big. I do not play on have very populated server, so running into people is slim.

Another slight negative, for some, is no names. When you see someone, there are no icons/names, so knowing if they are friend or foe is hard. Also, when you die/kill, there is no mention of it. You will never know if someone was killed near you or if you killed someone.

Loot is properly randomized and spread out. Guns are rare to come across, tools, bullets, equipment and backpacks are next, then food and cloths are easy to find.

Crafting is nice, but still slim. You get a basic crafting set, then must find books to read to learn new crafting items. These books are rare.

Realism is nice in this. You really need to pay attention and properly focus on your surroundings or you will miss alot.

Game is also eriely quiet. I play with speakers and have the sound turned up, but I still cannot hear everything until its upon me. Makes for some poop my pants moments.

The devs seem to be alive and ocntinue to improve the game, so if you like the games I mentioned above and prefer a game that brings alot of realism to it, then buy this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm 3 hours into this, so I'll update this review as I go, and I'm sorry that it'll be long, but I felt this needed to be said even with my short playtime already. I dove into this game with my brother, both fully aware that this game is a DayZ clone by no doubt, and that's part of the reason we enjoyed it all the more.

What I believe should be noted is that this DayZ clone that is Miscreated is more polished, and runs better than DayZ itself (Mod and standalone as I've played both) in every way possible. It may not be perfect, but the character movement, the camera changing, and the interface itself is smoother in its short progress than the awkward/clunkiness that DayZ has in the 3 years the standalone has been out, and however many years the DayZ mod has been out.

What I'm trying to say is... This game does DayZ better than DayZ.

PROS:

Structure-building (If you survive long enough, a base is nice)

Item-crafting - Finding books around gives you more crafting recipes to learn. Still not sure if you keep them when you die.

Salvageable vehicles to drive (Forget the pickup, we found a bike!)

House-to-house looting just like DayZ (Feels like more buildings are available)

No need for can openers to dive into those sweet, juicy canned pears.

Weather effects are some of the most beautiful I've ever seen in a game. Specifically when it starts thundering; it was so impressive, I thought it was actually thundering at my house it sounded so good. The rain started falling, forming small puddles on the ground with little reflections in them and it was breathtaking to see that good of development put into weather effects. Beautiful.

However, with all good things that come, we have to accept the bad as well. Miscreated as great as it is does not display absolute perfection in its current Early Access stage, and here's some examples as to why:

CONS:

Mutants (instead of zombies) aren't near as populated, so more PVP-focused (I consider this a good thing, but most wouldn't since it is a survival apocalypse, so I listed it as a con), but when you find them, boy are they a challenge as it takes 3-4 swings with my hatchet to kill one, and I'm at half health by the end of it.

Structure-crafting feels a little too extreme on materials that are too difficult to find (If I can barely survive players as it is, how am I gonna gain all these misc materials to build a boxed hut?)

In some instances, the survivor aspect isn't as much there food-wise because we came across two towns full of houses that we found an endless supply of food; so much food in fact that we started eating some just for the hell of it in order to make room in our backpacks for more. I know guns themselves are more scarce, but why am I finding 9mm/10mm/357 rounds for guns I don't have more than for my little .22 pistol?

CONCLUSION:

Is it worth it? Yes, if you liked the concept of DayZ, but want a more polished/enjoyable experience. I bought the 4-pack 50% off for $32, and that's cheaper than one copy of DayZ for $35. More worthwhile for me, personally. However, if you didn't like the DayZ experience at all and prefer something different, I'd avoid this one then as it's an attempt at the same genre, but better.

EDIT: Added Pro about weather effects and added detail about item crafting as well as adding a sort of Pro under the Con list of Mutants. Along with that, added a Con about food being more plentiful than necessary compared to the amount of guns/ammo you find.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI first played this game about six months ago and I criticized it very hard. Any little thing that I saw that wasn't great I hated. But coming back to this game after that six month break (Because I got the game and didn't play much of it because of everything I hated) I realized how much effort was put into this game and how beautiful the game world really is. And I also realized that I did not want to like this game because I did not want it to be better than DayZ. But it is. Now I guess you can label me as a DayZ Guy" because it is one of the most played games on my account
date: but just playing this game for 4 hours I already had way more fun then the 148 hours I have on DayZ at the moment. If you are a fan of survival games than you NEED to get Miscreated. It gets updated rather often which is what we all want when it comes to survival games. But there is one con to this game in my opinion. And that is the crafting system. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Miscreated is an open world survival game. It's similar to Day Z, but is more consistant with updates since it is still in Alpha. I won't give it a rating at the moment, because there's a lot of bugs to work out and I'd like to give the Devs a bit more time to squash them. Overall, this game has a ton of potential.

Here's a quick description...

You'll pick a server and spawn in with a flashlight and some clothes. First, you'll want to find clothes, food, water, weapons, etc. After that, you'll have some fun crafting and building bases, fixing up trucks to drive around, and encountering other survivors who will either be friendly or murder you on the spot for your stuff. Join up with them or take the other route.

The game gets really fun when you have friends to help collect items, raid, and build bases. There's definately safety in numbers. You'll also be dodging mutants both day and night, but it's the other survivors you should be worried about. To say the least, interesting things can happen when you run into other people in the local town. Exploration is a big part of Miscreated as well. The current map is massive and it's easy to get lost. If you die, you'll lose everything and spawn again. It's brutal, but it's part of the game's charm. You have to survive and defend yourself to keep what you've earned.

On the negative side, you'll run into a lot of bugs and glitches. Also, if you're a stickler for graphics, they might not meet all expectations, but it's a very satisfactory visual experience. As I stated before, it's still in alpha, so I'm definately watching this game to see where it goes.

So, would I recommend? Yes, but only for those who are open to experimental games. It's a lot of fun and I can enjoy playing this for a few hours on end with friends. Pick it up while it's on sale or check out one of the many giveaways.

Also, visit my page to read my Miscreated diary, where hilarity ensues when people encounter other people and injure them severly. It's a precurser to a video diary. Coming soon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

im reviewing early access version of the game, the build from june 13th 2015.

it may sound like a clishe, but i really think MISCREATED might be the post-apocalyptic survival game we've all waited for. the game runs so smooth, it looks beautiful, and atmosphere is out of this world. optimization is really on high level here. i run the game maxed out 100% and it runs smooth as butter. no stutter at all (well maybe a small one when entering towns, but it is almost non-existant). controls are very smoth and easy, movement in game and camera is amazing, from both 3rd and 1st person view. miscreated runs on cryengine3.

miscreated looks amazing. not only graphics, but all atmosphere in game is fantastic (the game looks so beautiful, that it is the only game which screenshots (made during my gameplay) i use as my desktop wallpapers :D ). it really has that post-apocalyptic vibe. nature looks very beautiful (wildlife is already present too), there are lot of small towns, small wood cabins in the wilderness, parks, ranches, military camps, crashsites, lookovers, lakes, swamps, gas stations, bridges, destroyed stuff on road, like spilled toxic stuff from truck tankers (little hints about radioactivity). micreated's world is so rich and amazing, you'll find yourself wanting to just explore and wander around, discover new locations, new areas, objects, etc... and all that is only one part of the whole bigger map that will be implemented in game soon. they also will add building bases and objects/barricading option (crafting is already there), and groups. battle royale mode is also planned in the future. there are lots of little things that make this game awesome, like driving cars and trucks without tires if you cant find em. like in real life, it is possible, a little rough and bumpy, but still possible. also lots of hidden" locations (like radioactive cave) that will blow you away. places like that is what will keep you just exploring this world of miscreated.
inventory system is really good too. classic slots for feet

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is an excellent game. It's a lot like DayZ 7 Days to Die and The Forest. Only difference is though this game succeeds in areas where these games have falling short. This game more closely represents DayZ and H1Z1. The difference is though it's so much more polished graphically it's excellent there is plenty of loot. The game is a survival game but it doesn't lose fun or entertainment for the survival aspect very well balanced between the two. Instead of zombies there are mutants. They're not overpowers or overwhelming like in Dayz. This game also receives meaningful and regular updates. I purchased DayZ the day it was released I wish I would've known about this one sooner and saved myself some money. I wish more people knew about this game it's excellent. If you're looking for a H1Z1 or DayZ experience but want one that's not so broken and enjoyable you would be missing out to not pick this one up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I think its the best survival - horror game on the market. Starting from DayZ idea, this horror - survival games have been developed a lot , but none of them are like this.

PRO:
- Graphic is amazing ! CryEngine is doing a huge difference.
- No brain - eating zombies but humans that suffered mutations from the radiations.
- The houses and the views are amazing , you dont find anything the same . Houses , areas , looting places. Everything is different.
- The developing team is there for you, assisting you, tell them your problems and they will help you.
- 1st person and 3rd person.
- Crafting system is not so extended but it has potential. Soon: BUILDING !!
- Bullet trajectory will change based on gravity, air resistance, and wind
- Low levels of food and hunger have a negative impact on your character’s performance
- Rain, fog, wind + other weather patterns are all dynamically generated and will create unique game play opportunities.
- The game features a real 24 hour clock based on the location of the server you are playing on !!!

CONS: ( ! YOU MUST EXPECT THIS ON AN ALPHA GAME ! )

- Server problems sometimes.
- FPS drops, freezes .

In one word : BUY THIS GAME

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has a lot of potential. There is a lot that could be improved. Examples such as Hunting for food, Storage system. Maybe some advancements to the UI. I would recommend this game to people who enjoy the survival aspect with base building. I would not recommend this game to those who can not live with a few bugs and incomplete features. All in all, great job so far. Can't wait to see full release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is early access, so my review is based on what's there, not on what's not.
Within the first 5 minutes of playing, I fell in love with the world.  Everything is very detailed, and feels optimized as I haven't seen any drops in FPS.  It was worth the price just for exploration.  You can find games with bigger worlds, but this one doesn't have the huge expanses of nothing that you need to travel through just to get anywhere.  So, while it is smallish, it doesn't feel that way.
There are what look to be mutants instead of zombies, and they seem to travel in packs.  I've encounted a couple, and was brought down to 20% health with a couple of hits, so it does teach you respect early on.
Loot seems easy to find, though I haven't seen a huge variety of items.
The big thing was that the people who play seemed a bit nicer than in other games.  You still get your banditry, but I've only had one KOS experience in the few days I've been playing, which is a big difference from H1Z1.
If you're on the fence on this one, I'd say go for it.  I've had it on my wishlist for months and when I finally got it, I was pleasantly surprised.
voteText: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is an excellent game. It's a lot like DayZ 7 Days to Die and The Forest. Only difference is though this game succeeds in areas where these games have falling short. This game more closely represents DayZ and H1Z1. The difference is though it's so much more polished graphically it's excellent there is plenty of loot. The game is a survival game but it doesn't lose fun or entertainment for the survival aspect very well balanced between the two. Instead of zombies there are mutants. They're not overpowers or overwhelming like in Dayz. This game also receives meaningful and regular updates. I purchased DayZ the day it was released I wish I would've known about this one sooner and saved myself some money. I wish more people knew about this game it's excellent. If you're looking for a H1Z1 or DayZ experience but want one that's not so broken and enjoyable you would be missing out to not pick this one up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I think its the best survival - horror game on the market. Starting from DayZ idea, this horror - survival games have been developed a lot , but none of them are like this.

PRO:
- Graphic is amazing ! CryEngine is doing a huge difference.
- No brain - eating zombies but humans that suffered mutations from the radiations.
- The houses and the views are amazing , you dont find anything the same . Houses , areas , looting places. Everything is different.
- The developing team is there for you, assisting you, tell them your problems and they will help you.
- 1st person and 3rd person.
- Crafting system is not so extended but it has potential. Soon: BUILDING !!
- Bullet trajectory will change based on gravity, air resistance, and wind
- Low levels of food and hunger have a negative impact on your character’s performance
- Rain, fog, wind + other weather patterns are all dynamically generated and will create unique game play opportunities.
- The game features a real 24 hour clock based on the location of the server you are playing on !!!

CONS: ( ! YOU MUST EXPECT THIS ON AN ALPHA GAME ! )

- Server problems sometimes.
- FPS drops, freezes .

In one word : BUY THIS GAME

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wish there was a middle Neutral option for Reviews because in it's current state that's what i'd give this Game.

The Good:

Cry-Engine 3 can be a brilliant Engine at times, the Foliage and fauna are amazing in the right contexts (short to mid range stuff) where you can actually hide in thick Bushes and tree-lines with the Plants reacting to your movement. I've played the Game quite a lot and this still impresses me. The environments can look amazing, like mentioned, particularly the Foliage and this Game really does a good job at selling over-grown/abandoned areas and it does it 100x better than Games like H1Z1 where environments just look flat and lifeless.

The bad:

At longer ranges, this stuff basically just goes away as due to LOD stuff foliage etc doesn't look that great (models like fences etc also fade out at distance meaning that someone hiding behind and object at range may think they were hidden but would be being seen by people a far distance off) other systems like the loot system and AI are also for a lack of a better word, bland.

AI:

In their current state glitchy, annoying and just un-fun to fight, they really don't add anything to the Game and the actual chracter models/design I find quite boring (imagine the Mutants from I am Ledgend but with a gigantic Spike for an arm) there's also Wildlife (like Deer/Squirrels etc) but these are just stock Cry-Engine assets/systems the developers have thrown in and don't really serve any other function than looking nice.

Optimization:

Quite bad TBH. I can run the Game at an ok Framerate with stuff turned down (hovers at around 30fps) with what I would call a semi-decent Computer (i5 4670k, GTX 770, 8GB Ram) but overtime the longer you play it just seems to deteriorate to point where I either just quit playing or restart the Game.

This has been the trend for as long as I can remember with this Game, sometimes they seem to do something that increases FPS sometimes they do something that decreases it and overall updates end up feeling like a bit of a mess (they basically have to re-relase the same thing a few times to get it 'right') lower end Computers may have difficulty even connecting to servers as a lot of people complain about the loading icon just hanging and being kicked back to the browser.

Loot:

I find the loot placement in this Game to be a bit bad tbh for a number of reasons:

The Models are very bright and just look out of place with the Grungy run-down evironment they're in

Items are placed seemingly randomly about the place with no real thought or imagination put into their placement

Sound:

I find this really lacking, not only are a lot of the sounds just bad to Begin with (particularly Weapon sounds) they're also really glitchy. Sometimes sounds that should be quiet (like footsteps) can play across the entire Map while you won't hear a pick-up truck that's about to run you over from behind due to sound Glitches.

Game-play:

This Game can be really fun due to the novelty of stuff like Foliage etc but that are a lot of issues taht get in the way of enjoying it:

Shooting mechanics aren't that great TBH neaither are the models or the overall 'Feel' of Weapons (They feel flat and unsatisfying to use) combine this with rubberbanding and what seems like at times very spotty Net-Code and you can wind up with some very annoying and seemingly unfair Gun-Fights.

Back-Story/enemy and Character design:

I find this a bity lacking TBH, the Story reads like a Poor mans Fallout. IMO, given the aesthetic of the environment and how the it feels they should've gone down more of a Stalker-ish route with the Story and Monster Designs.

Player Characters are good enough and do the job but I find the enemy NPC designs just boring, bland and un-imaginative. They have a lot of scope to do something more original than just Enemies that may aswell just be Zombies chasing you around the environment (which is what the current placeholder AI basically are).


Overall:

If you ar a fan of FPS' or Survival Games in general and have a decent enough computer to run this Game i'd say get it as it can be fun even in it's current state, i've had more fun playing this than I have with Games like H1Z1 or Day-Z which I just could not get into. If you're on the fence and don't have hardware that's all that decent or only meets the minimum requirements i'd say avoid it.

Needs more content, more optimization and some aspects completely overhauled but does have potential to be a Fun and unique Game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has captured the true meaning of a survival game!!

First played this game a few weeks back and for the first 10 mins was freezing every 10 seconds and I nearly gave up on it but after troubleshooting the problem I heard it goes away after 10 mins, and it did :). The base building is not over complecated like some other survival games are, simple materials and doesn't take long to build a simple base for you and your pals. The game is stunning to look at and when the rendering gets more advanced it will truly be the best looking game out there.

Cons:
I found that the gun fights are not as engaging as the gunfights in DayZ but thats because guns and ammo are probably easier to find, I should imagine when I get a lot of good gear things will get a little more tense.
They do however need to add storage box's for bases as the only way of storing things is in a car and they are hard to come by and even then it's not certain it will be there when you log back in.

Overall this game is awesome as has got me hooked and coming back for more, I just hope it becomes more of a community and clans grow to build some absolute mega structures rather than the KOS that always comes with games like these.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I stated playing this game as soon as it was released in October of 2014. The game at the time was awful, it was laggy, the creatures were just awful, small map, and well just not a lot of things going on. I played off and on last year not really putting a lot of time into the game mostly after a patch I would check it out.

So after the latest patch I jumped in and being a few months of not playing I can say this game as taken a turn for the best. The creatures are still annoying if anything and glitchy still but improved sense the launch of EA. I do know they will improve as they develop the game so I am not holding it agenst the devs I know it is a work in progress.

I used to have a hard time finding everything I needed to get a truck or tractor working. Yes you need to find everything oil, gas, 4 tires, drive belt, battery, and spark plugs. Finding all of that is a lot of work but I was finally able to get everything together in this one town and drove off in a orange truck. Man was it fun, and going from town to town and finding little gas stations along the way was a joy.

The map is ever growing, I finally found a in game map. When I opened it it shows part of the world is red so i assume that is parts of the map that will be unlocked as we go through EA and that is a great thing to see. The world looks great, and the towns really make you feel alone in the world. The level of detail that has been put into making everything look post-apocalyptic is great.

The crafting is moving right along, it takes time to build a base and a good one at that. You need to really scavange to find things. It really makes it a challenge and really makes it feel like you are surviving".

I would recommend this game just for the fact its not dayz
date: its so much better then dayz. This is a great game to play with friends and you can create a clan with your friends. The level of detail put into the world is awsome and the devs should get a high five. psst hey dayz devs.....this is what the world should look like.\n\nSo buy into the game you wont regreat it
recommended: I did when it first launched but I am so happy now that I did and you will be to."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is EA so of course there are problems and this is a fairly small team of people working on this title so content is a little slow in coming out.

That being said this game is finally to a point where its getting really fun to play and with the stuff they have coming to the game soon it will only get better. Right now this is the only EA survival game i have installed and its the only one i need.

Only reason to wait on buying this game now would be that there is no storage system, so building a base is nice and all but there not much point cause you cant build storage chests. Only items on your person will save on log out. BUT with there new AI and net code systems coming online storage containers are one of there top priorities!

My ratings.
Graphics: 9/10 (its amazing but not perfect)

Sound: 6/10 (This could use a lot of work IMO, i dont like the gun sounds AT ALL and some sounds will just not play when other SFX are going off. bugs i assume)

Gameplay 7.5/10 (only 7.5 cause it is fun dont get me wrong but things a survival game should have are still missing but thats what there new AI and net code will fix. Once those are fixed it will probably be a 8.5 or even a 9 for me cause every thing else is already there for this to be great, just need that storage and hunting systems in!)

Overall: 7.5 (Its a good game that just needs a few more things to make it amazing. If you have any doubts about this game, i would say pick it up when its on sale and just try it out, very fun and you will see that the game is always moving forwards. All be it slowly, i believe it will still be one of the best survival games near the end of 2016)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game doesn't run smoothly on my pc, it's beyond it's capabilities.
from the first few minutes playing this, even with lag and render issues, this game is very clearly a good early access game.

It isn't perfect, in fact, i am certain that it is not yet close to the level the developers are wanting to reach with it. However, the world seems well designed and built, and you aren't instantly overrun with Zekes as they are fewer are further between than in most of this genre of game.

There is a very true sense that there was a mass culling during the war prior to the games setting. This makes the less frequent zombie run ins far more realistic and make the world feel li9ke it has been severely depolulated due to said war.


I would definitely reccomend this over some of the more npc populated games in the genre, this has the feel of a post war zombie scenario that could be more beleivably likely.
Reccomended without hesitation!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOK, so after a while of playing I'll do a review. The game for the lack of a better word (imo) is amazing. The level of detail put forth and the commitment by the devs is just top noch. The addition of player built bases with an actual type of control over where they can be done is perfect. This game has everything that a survival game would want and more coming. Not everyone is KOS so makes meeting new people possible, its how I met the clan AFD and run with them. Base building is very well done with plenty to make it your own area and fortify it up. I started playing when outta the max servers you were lucky to get 20 people across em all. Boy has that changed, now you can rent your own or play on official. I'd say a good 75-80% of the servers are over 1/2 full and growing. I fully support this game and try my hardest to get others to join up. Either through streaming it or just bugging the hell outta my buddies till they fork the money out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE: This review is getting some light, and I had a developer comment on my review. He states that the Devs aren't reviewing the game and liking their own reviews, yet in the same comment mentions that he did a review for the game, it was a joke review, and didn't actually state his opinion on said game. While this is true, it is a review that recommends the game, so, joke or not, he did provide a score AND did review the game, as a Dev. Below are my thoughts on the game.

This game is terrible. I have wasted my time and money with this purchase and I advise anyone who reads this review to NOT PURCHASE! The game has a decent community for this type of game, this is true. However, in the time that I have played the game, I only ran into one player and one monster. That is a little over an hour of gameplay, running around and doing nothing.

It is like Day Z, but there is very little crafting, there are hardly ANY monsters in the game. And no, I don't feel a sense of panic or a sense of urgency while playing. In fact, I have tried playing the game twice and have gotten bored through it both times. I have run into buildings and vehicles in which still have no textures on them. They are only polygons of those items. This game has been in development and available for purchase since October. The fact that there are still missing textures is quite ridiculous. Also, add the fact that monsters are nearly nowhere to be found, as are players, and you end up with a game that has very little play value.

To be completely honest, after I had stumbled upon my sixth pair of sunglasses, fourth shirt and second pair of pants (with nothing else to be found) I realized that all the houses on that block looked identical, had nothing in them, and looked worse than other games of this genre (H1Z1, ARK, etc). Honestly, I can't recommend this game in its current state. I can't ask anyone to play this game.

Please, save your money and your time and look at other, better, survival games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been playing Miscreated for a quite a good amount of time and i absolutly love it.

I've lost count of how many times i've died and how many kills i've got, but all that doesn't matter in the end, when i see the beautiful scenery and environment. The textures, the lighting, the trees, everything is awesome!

The gameplay is smooth and straight forward!! Shoot, hit, dead, no lagspikes and there's bullet drop which makes the game a bit more challenging, but it's something you learn by playing.

I love the idea of crafting guides scattered around the world so everybody just know the BASIC stuff, instead of everybody building mansions and all that, it gives the game a bit more survival feel to it.

Pros:
+ Wonderful environment.
+ Large areas.
+ Smooth multiplayer.
+ Looting, mining materials and crafting works great!
+ Heart racing when meeting other players (do they, or do they not want to kill you).

Cons:
- Still som issues that needs resolving.
- Graphical bugs, you wont notice.
- Quite a long loading time, but for a game this detailed, it's okay.

Conclusion:
This game is the best buy i've done in a long time, and could pretty much be a gamechanger in the survival genre.
Can highly recommend to everybody.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS IS HANDS DOWN THE BEST AND MOST BEAUTIFUL AND WELL OPTIMIZED EARLY ACCESS SURVIVAL GAME EVER!! SO WORTH BUYING!!!!

Pros: GOOD STUFF (PREPARE FOR A LONG READ)

+ Base building (sorry no storage just yet will be a while small team it takes time)
+ NEW Weather update is AMAZING! SO IMMERSIVE SO BEAUTIFUL SO MUCH FUN CHASING TORNADOS. People are grouping together to chase them.
+ The New SVOGI render makes lighting so amazing you have never seen anything this good.
+ Runs on Cry Engine, at 1360x768 I get 38-50fps at medium/very high with a 6 year old gtx480!
+ Freeform base building! Place it where you want but no floating items :)
+ Plenty of mutants. They are dangerous & Mutants have aggro animation thing it looks smooth as hell
+ Amazing animations ladder climbing is perfect in third person and first person
+ Has Emotes! F2 - F10 i think but yeah you can wave stick fingers up thumb up, thumb down etc
+ Vegetationi is beutiful and there is bending with moving in bushes and sounds :D
+ Extremely Immersive!, You get drawn into this game and forget what life is
+ Has Crafting, from learning recipes to make more stuff for your base or weapons such as molotov, baseball bat with nails in
+ Learning recipes for stuff like work lights around the base :D
+ Simple crafting menu no instructions needed
+ Simple UI it does the job very well
+ Big area to run around in and map will be getting bigger!
+ Towns feel like towns plenty of buildings and things
+ Feels like a real place not some fantasy makes no sense kinda thing.
+ Has vehicles, Pick up truck, Airport luggage carrier thing, Bicycle and Quad Bike/ATV, Boat
+ Can Sit in the back of pickup its awesome
+ Can repair vehicles or heal people using a lug wrench/ Tyre Iron
+ Vehicles require parts to get them going but you can drive without tyres just it doesn't work as good and flips out a lot :D
+ Hidden Caves to explore! There is a nice atmosphere to them!
+ Blowing up jerry cans / Petrol cans is fun you can catch on fire and become a human torch
+ Fire on character is awesome, lost a torch? Simple burn yourself it looks great! :D
+ TORNADO!!! ITS AMAZING! The sound is amazing too!
+ Nice Sounds! Not only pleasing visuals pleasing on the ears too.
+ Foot prints! You can draw ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in the sand :D
+ Actually has a race track!
+ Updates are always better and if one doesn't work to well there is usually a hotfix that comes not too long after!
+ At the moment the community is great! Try voiping or text talking you'll find nice people
+ BamBam Tshirts ingame are awesome :3
+ Has squirrells deer and i think a snake or something too
+ Kythera AI system the same guys doing the ai in star citizen
+ Day Night Cycle, Night looks amazing too the screenshots don't do it justice
+ Glowsticks/Chemlights are fun and light up the area :D Different colors too
+ It has pink smoke grenades! Colored smoke is awesome
+ The wind from the storm is amazing with the trees moving about and struggling to see
+ Physics on the cloth thing at race track is amazing. Just run into it you'll see it wraps round you and things.
+ Clever design, the same buildings do not feel exactly the same. Everything feels unique
+ Crafted 5.56 with red dot is amaze (I gave it to rick grimes before i had to go)
--------------------------------------------
Cons: BAD STUFF @.@  (Not many nothing really game breaking)
- Some invent bugs
- Not enough vehicles around they get horded so quickly and locked away in tough bases
- Small team = takes time for things to come
- No storage as of yet will be implemented down the line when they get stuff going (give them time guys stop complaining about it just enjoy it for what it is because it wont be in this state forever)
- Few clothing clipping issues.
- Needs more wind at times during the day or night like the thing at the race track goes crazy in the wind but the grass is really calm and trees only move during storm
- Swimming bug sometimes you swim above the water
- Mutants do need work on their pathfinding and the way they come at you and just being aggrod in general
---------FINAL THOUGHTS (well so far will come back to edit in future :D )----------
For a small team, this is one game with a hell a lot of quality to it. Everything is beutiful in this game, the water, the grass, the trees, the foliage in general, bushes moving when something is in them the sounds, the rain effects, the building designs, the clever non repeating pattern of the same buildings. Honestly this game is just so underrated. If your looking to play dayz try this instead fps are better and its a lot more enjoyable. This is going to be more amazing with more updates and worth every penny even when not on sale

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Miscreated is an amazing game, This game is one of the best games I have invested in and I am very happy to say that I have supported it. Miscreated only has more good to come, the game is based mostly off community suggestions which means if you make a good enough suggestion that most of the community favors it may be added. The developers are very interactive and are always open to suggestions, this is always good in a game. Overall, I think the game is very good and has a ton of potential If you want to support a game I would say support this one.

*EDIT* 11/10/2015

Recently I have been playing miscreated again to see how far the game has come, I am completely blown away by the progress they have made. The map has gotten much bigger, there is a ton of new loot, and not to mention the vehicles and basebuilding. The graphics have always looked great but with there new lighting it is breath taking, everything from interiors of buildings to plain open feilds looks beautiful. The newely added bunkers and caves add a whole nother dynamic to the game, the dark atmoshperes of the caves and bunkers add a perfect area for some creepy player interaction ;) aswell as some awesome exploration elements to the game. All and all this game is constantly expanding and adding to its already amazing features, If you have the slightest intrest in the game I would suggest picking it up and if you really dont like it then just refund your purchase. See you all ingame <3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First and foremost, everyone needs to know this is an EARLY ACCESS game...meaning there are glitches, there are problems, that's just the way it is.

A friend recently donated this game to me, so it doesn't hurt to try it out.  Having played it for only about 4 hours, I think I would have definitely purchased it myself.
It is a survival game -  much like DayZ and H1Z1 but with the elements of Rust or Ark.   There is a crafting aspect as well as a building aspect.
It's a grindy game -  it takes a long time to get ahead.

Loot -  particularly weapons -  are difficult to find. I may not have been in the right area to look for weapons as it was my first time playing and I still only explored half of the map -  perhaps weapon spawns were not where I was.
The mutants are almost impossible to kill without a solid weapon (ie: a gun).
There is no good, official map for this game which makes it difficult to learn (but, I suppose that's  kind of cheating anyway, hey?)
All in all - I like the game. Yes, I would have purchased it myself, Yes, I recommend it...but you gotta be aware that its going to be glitchy.

I had a lot of fun playing the game - and I have really only just explored the tip of the iceberg with it, I am sure...so my review will be quite vague at this point.

PROS:
-Survival game with many aspects- crafting, building, surviving
-Not overly populated with players
-PVP and PVE servers available

CONS:
-Mutants are WAY too OP
-Servers drop a lot I have noticed
-Sparse weapon loot

My Suggested Improvements:
-More character skins options (only white male available now)
-Decrease strength of mutants or Increase weapon spawns locations to enable better defense tactics against mutants
-A better, official map needs to be made

Once I have had a chance to better play the game I will write another review.

In short -  fun game, is recommended

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros
-Great Loot system
-The best building system of any survival game by far, 100% free-form but simple enough that anyone can make a decent looking base
-Good bullet physics, with both bullet drop and windage taken into affect
-NPC enemies that you actually have to worry about, not just use for target practice
-By far the best terrain graphics of any survival game
-Water physics, water actually flows and rivers will carry you down stream if you're not careful

Cons
-This game is truely an Alpha so it has a LOT of bugs, if you do buy it be ready to troubleshoot. In the end though it is worth every minute to make it work
-As well optimized as it is, it still needs a pretty decent PC to play. Not really a con but its something people should know

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A few positive things about this game so far. (3 Hours in)
Totally worth the money.

-Stunning visuals
-Friendly players
-Guns aren't hard to find.
-Ammo isn't hard to find.
-All buildings are open.
-You don't need to walk for 10 minutes to find a single house
-Zombies aren't dull (and ragdoll when they die)
-Zombies actually die from gunshots (looking at you DayZ)
-VEHICLES!!!

Now a few downsides
-The map isn't that big (could be positive, depending on how you look at it.)
-The only ''friendly'' people are the ones with guns, but no ammo.
-Still Early acces so glitches can occur
-The night is absolutely terrifying. (Could also be positive, if you're into that.)
-Zombies can spawn right beside you (still an early access game)

The game plays smooth, and doesn't feel clunky like some other early access survival horror games.*Cough*DayZ*Cough*

Overall in my opinion it's an 8/10 and totally worth the money (Especially during steam sales)

Been playing this game for two days and a quite of a few hours first im going to start with the cons:
1.We need a map because theres moments where i walk forever and i dont know where im going.
2.Weapons i know its not fun if theres so many but the only place i find guns is the airfield or if im lucky enough in a car but everytime theres no ammo there should be at least a clip in the gun to be fair.
3.Distances i know theres cars but it takes a while to set up one i think the company should come up with a way we can move easier around the map to get to our destinations.
4.Respawns i know its not logical to repsawn exacly where you died but i mean come on i was with a friend at the airfield and i got respawned on Wood something.
5.Items i spend hours finding items and one shot to the head all gone i wish there was a solution for this.
6.Objectives should be made like missions some it keeps the player oqupied people get bored of just looting give us a reason to play more and more

Now Pros:
1.Great visual effectes but one problem i noticed although i dont have cryengine my pc is very strong i have higher specifications but still i have frame rate problems.
2.I love wondering around and scavenging for items but i wish it could be more rewarding
3.Base biulding this feature is going to be great and i hope you guys make the beds spawn points.
4.Mutants great idea to try something diffrent but it feels lonley when theres only 2 mutants in a town make it interesting.

Early Access Review

My thoughts after a few hours of this game:

recommended: it just seems to be collect gear and kill other players - which would have been good enough for now if you could actually count on killing players when you shot them and clearly ought to have killed them."

Early Access Review

Ok to start off this is nothing like DayZ or H1Z1. This is Far More Better  in Graphics, World, Gameplay and more, yea sure it lacks some optimalization but if your PC isn't good enough for you then it's not good enough for anything. Updates come usually monthly or 2 week period, soo there's nothing like DayZ Development Hell. The Map in this Game is Huge, Amazing and still has something new. Day And Night are kinda alright except day lasts 3 and half hours of normal time and night does like so, soo believe me when I say join servers that have Daytime. Players in this game are not any aholes, they won't try to shoot you because you have backpack and they don't. Ammo in this game is rare, mostly sniper rifles ammo.
Soo Will i Recommend this Game? Yes!
Was it Worth 7.50E? Yes!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best survival game I have ever played, I own DayZ Standalone, the DayZ mod for Arma, Rust, H1z1, And the forest. This game is better than all of them in my oppinion. When you see the mixed user reviews don't be turned off by this game most of those bad review where from early stages of the game when it was much more buggy and did not have as much content.

Pros:
Graphics: They look absolutley stunning.
Optimization: You can run this game on high settings with a decent computer without any problems.
Vehicles: For a game that hasent even been out for a year this is an amazing accomplishment.
Basebuilding: it is coming very soon! The dev team released a video about a week ago from the time im posting this review about basebuilding. This basebuilding in my oppinion will be better than any other survival game out right now, let alone that they are already releasing basebuilding is amazing.

CONS:
Fighting and A.I. : At the moment the fighting system is wacky it is very hard to fight anything including the mutants that can apparently see me through walls but they will fix this all very soon.
Bugs: They will fix them.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just purchased this and have 4hrs of time as of this review for an initial impression.


As far as an EA game goes, this is an easy 7.5/10 and will be following this game closely.

-Graphics are solid! Very nice shadows, ray tracing is excellent, both day and night effects are near AAA.
-Sounds are good, but ambience is lacking,
-Map size is a touch small, but seems appropriate at this time.
-No issues with weapons at all.
-Combat is a lot of fun.
-I haven't tried any base building as of yet, but the crafting works well for what I have used it for.
-Mutants (Zombies) are all over the place and fun to deal with.  Swarms happen and well, they suck to deal with.


Is this a DayZ killer? Not yet, but it is well on it's way to be what DayZ wants to be.

Early Access Review

This is easily the most polished, best looking and well optimized early access I have played. The feel of the game is awesome. It has that alan wake kinda feel to it especially in 3rd person.

I own most of the big survival games like h1z1, dayz, 7 days to die, forest ect and this really does have the potential to beat the lot of them.

I really don't understand all this hate 7 days to die runs like rubbish looks like rubbish but yet it gets mostly positive reviews! yeah the crafting might be pretty cool but the choppy frames and bad graphics isn't. The same goes for dayz it runs like crap yet people give it the big thumbs up even though it launched in 2013 and still runs like crap.

This game runs smooth as butter, can't wait to get into it more. I'm really hoping the devs put the work in and make the game great because it does have so much potential. it's just sad to see it getting mixed reviews!.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I almost tried out every survival games in a post-apocalyptic setting and I might say this game really show some great potential, Yes it's smaller than Dayz, Yes there is less loot or stuff to do than Dayz but I see way more potential in this game and mainly because of :
-Great visuals ( CryEngine)
-Really good performance (for an early access game)
-Great community
-Active Devs
-A good map ( the cities are not too far away )
-Base building system
-Almost everything is open ( you can go in anything (no locked doors)
-Almost No kill on sight
-The Dev plan on way more features

the cons :
-the lack of guns
-all new spawned cars have no wheels, batteries or anything
-every cars item weigth too much
-The airport is the place where you will find too much guns vs any other places
-some bugs
-flickering sky when time/weather changes

Yes I recommend
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even though I have only played 3.4 hour so far, I can honestly see the bright future of the game. When I was first buying it, I was sceptical about my decision, but once I logged in into the server, I instantly fell in love.

Graphics and physics look good. Better than DayZ at least.

Of course there are couple bugs and glitches, poor GUI and so on, but I'm sure dev's will fix it and make it look all nice.

This is a first game where I havent been shot once, for all time playing!

I met 2 guys that I was surviving with. It was fun!

Monsters are decent. A bit laggy but at least look unique.

Once again, this game has some minor bugs and glitches, so do not expent the best gameplay.

Worth it? Hell yeah.

Will definitely play more! <3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Started off alone at night, in the rain. Scavenged some houses and found a shotgun plus a .22 rifle, but couldn't take both, so I took the shotgun. I found a group of people who were friendly (though it was tense wondering if they were going to shoot me in the back). They had no guns, but they gave me ammo. We walked around for a while chatting a bit and I started to feel comfortable, then we decided to go to the airfield. They kept giving me helpful items while explaining how the game works. And then the server crashed...

So we all decide to log out and in again, except this time, as soon as I log in, there's someone else who decided to shoot on sight. As he walked around a corner, one of the guys I was hanging out with stepped in front of me as he logged in, so I basically ended up shooting the guy who I'd been chatting to for the past hour, the guy who gave me ammo and other helpful items, right in the face. Then the guy who I was trying to hit shoots me and I collapse, dead.

Now one guy probably thinks I'm the biggest ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ he's ever come across, as I more than likely shattered his confidence when it comes to new players, and another ran off with my shotgun + supplies.

feelsbadman.jpg

I'll wait until it's done before I play again, but this game is everything DayZ should have been. It runs amazingly, it feels good to move, the controls aren't janky, it looks great, and it has a lot of future potential. Plus it was only $10. Definitely recommend.
